101722.name: Courtesans
rpghonor: 2011 Indie RPG Award - Game of the Year - Runner-Up
101722.description:
Subtitle: A seductive game of Sex and Society

From the text:

Courtesans is a Roleplaying Game. Not necessarily that sort of 'roleplaying game', but if that's what floats your boat don't let me stop you.

Anyway Courtesans casts you, the Players, as Ladies of the Demi Monde, the half world below the respectability of society, who are scandalously free with their favours. Well not free. They have a price, be it money or something more ephemeral. Though you share a house with the Characters of the other Players you are in competition with them. Let the backstabbing and the bitchiness commence!

101723.name: Hungarian Tarokk
101723.description:
Hungarian Tarokk, also known as Húszashívásos tarokk (XX-calling tarokk), or Paskievics tarokk, is a four player, variable partnership, trick taking tarot game. As with most games in this genre, the base objective of each round is to capture a certain amount of card points (in this case, more than half) in tricks. However, each round of Hungarian Tarokk starts with a peculiar round of auctions and announcements that impart a lot of information about the players' hands, which make it a very skillful, challenging, yet surprisingly accessible game.

It uses a shortened pack of 42 cards: the trump suit consists of 22 cards while the other four suits consist of only five cards each. The size of each player’s hand is only nine cards (with a talon of six cards).

Each round starts with a short auction in which players bid for the right to choose a partner that holds a particular high ranking trump card, usually the XX. The bid itself determines the number of cards the winner of the auction may exchange (higher bids mean less cards exchanged) and the base value of game (to capture more than half of the card points in tricks) in points.

Players have restrictions on how they may bid; in particular, a player may only bid only if he or she holds an honour (the lowest trump, the second-highest trump, or the highest trump). In addition, there are bidding conventions that, unlike Bridge, are part of the rules. These conventions, or "invitation bids," indicate if a player holds a particular high ranking trump.

After players exchange cards with the talon, there is a round of announcements. Partnerships can pursue additional objectives other than game:

- Winning three-fourths of the card points
- Winning all the tricks
- Winning all three honours
- Winning all four kings
- Winning the last trick with the lowest trump
- XXI-catch: Capturing the opponent's second highest trump with the highest trump

During the round of announcements, a partnership may announce that they will accomplish one or more of these objectives, which doubles their value. A partnership may also challenge or kontra an announcement, which also doubles its value. These objectives are scored independently; a team can fail at accomplishing game but still accomplish (and score for) other objectives. Often, the value of these objectives is greater than game. For example, the base value of game ranges from 1 to 4 points, while the value of XXI-catch is 21 points.

101724.name: World Snooker Challenge 2007
101724.description:
User Summary:
World Snooker Challenge 2007 is a sports simulator from Sega. In the game you can play as one of the top 91 players in the world, including John Higgins, Ronnie O'Sullivan and Steve Davis, of make your own player. You can play Positional play, Golden Cue, Trickshot, and Championship. Besides snooker there's also pool (8 ball and 9 ball). The game includes commentary from John Parrot, Steve Davis and John Virgo.

101725.name: Space War (Atari 2600)
101725.description:
Game Manual

Space War Games

You and your opponent blast off into space. Each player controls one Star Ship with the Joystick Controller. The object is to score points by shooting your opponent's Star Ship with missiles fired by the red button on your Joystick Controller. Aim the nose of your Star Ship in the direction you want to fire. Space War games last ten minutes or until one player scores ten points. Player's scores appear at the top of the playfield and are color coordinated with the Star Ships. The two lines to the right of your score refer to fuel and missile supply. The top line is the fuel gauge; the bottom line is the amount of missiles remaining.

Each player begins with eight missiles. Once the arsenal is depleted, the game will automatically reset each player with eight more missiles ONLY when both players are out of missiles. In most War games, fuel cannot be resupplied. In games 6 and 7, players can refuel and resupply missiles by docking with the Starbase. Fuel is used by adding "thrust" to your Star Ship or by putting your Ship into Hyperspace.

Space Shuttle Games

If you have mastered the exercises, you are ready to try Space Shuttle. Connect your Star Ship with the Space Module to score. Recommended strategy is to first match your Star Ship's speed to the Space Module's speed. Then slowly maneuver your Star Ship towards the Space Module. During Shuttle games the Star Ships have an unlimited supply of fuel. In one-player games, you control one Star Ship with the left Joystick Controller and compete against the clock. You have ten minutes to score a maximum ten points. During two-player games each player maneuvers his Star Ship to score. In two-player games with two Space Modules, the target Space Module will be the same color as your Star Ship. First player to score ten points or the most points in ten minutes wins.

101726.name: KillingZone Defense
101726.description:
Get Ready for a Non-Stop Action Survival Defense game, KillingZone Defense! KillingZone Defense is a fun animated Non-Stop Action Survival Defense game with the elements of role-playing, strategy and time management game, all in one! Use the special abilities and weapons of each character to strengthen the overall defense level. John and the survivors must fight for their lives and protect their villages. You will enjoy hours of game play and fast paced action! You can select the weapons and special skills by touch control!

Source: The Publisher Website.

101727.name: Shadowlands
101727.description:
Shadowlands is a computer game developed by Domark in 1992 for the PC/MS-DOS, Amiga and Atari ST. Shadowlands is a fantasy role-playing game in which the player has four game characters, that the player can operate either as a squad or as independents during the course of the adventure.

Source: Wikipedia, "Shadowlands (video game)" available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101728.name: Thunder Blade
videogameversion: North American Sega Master System edition
101728.description:
Thunder Blade (サンダーブレード)is an arcade, shooter released for Sega Master System, Amiga, Amstrad CPC, Atari ST, Commodore 64, DOS, MSX, TurboGrafx-16, ZX Spectrum. The player controls a helicopter using guns and missiles to destroy enemy tanks, helicopters, etc, to save his home country. Levels are in both a top-down or third-person perspective view. The boss levels are in the top-down view. The game also introduced the use of force feedback, where the joystick vibrates. The game's plot and setting resembles the 1983 film and 1984 TV series of Blue Thunder.

Source: Wikipedia, "Thunder Blade," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101729.name: Sea Hawk
101729.description:
Game Manual

A steady hand and quick wits are crucial if you are going to win this action packed air-sea battle! You must constantly dodge enemy fire and possible collisions with enemy helicopters and ships.

As the game begins, you have eight Sea Hawk fighter planes in your defense arsenal but can only use one at a time. Your weapons include a machine gun and an unlimited supply of torpedoes. The black AtakLaunch ships and E-Gull helicopters are the enemy and you must eliminate them.

If your plane is hit by enemy fire, your pilot will parachute to safety, but he needs your help to reach one of your Red Hawk aircraft carriers. If he lands in the ocean or on an enemy ship, he's dead. For now only one enemy helicopter will appear on screen at a time.

You graduate to Level 2 when you score 10,000 points. The battle grows more furious as two enemy E-Gull helicopters appear on screen to do battle with you.

The intensity increases when you score 30,000 points and enter Level 3. Here you will be attacked by three E-Gull helicopters that boldly challenge you, determined to down your planes!

101730.name: Horse Race Game
101730.description:
This is a fun game for 2 players. You are trying to race a horse to the finish line, but along the way some of the holes will "swallow" up your horse and you have to start all over with a new horse. First one to the finish wins!

Object: Be the first to get a "horse" peg to the finish line
Rules: Each player selects a color. Players alternate turns rolling the single die. From the starting position move a peg the number of holes as on the dice roll. Note that SOME of the holes in the board have no bottom. A horse that lands here will fall through he board into the box and be out of the game. Player must then start at the beginning with a new horse. Winner is the first person to reach the last hole on an exact roll, or if a player loses all his pegs, the remaining player is the winner.
Alternate play rules: You may enter more than 1 horse of your color on the board. You must make a legal move every roll, and 2 horses cannot occupy the same hole.

101731.name: American McGee's Grimm: Episode 19 – Mulan
101731.description:
A well-muscled young girl dresses up as a manly man and fights in the Chinese army for twenty years, without a single awkward moment at the latrine. Highly improbable. Grimm presents this classic Chinese tale in the original Mandarin. Oh, and if you ever wanted to how the”Yellow River” was named, Grimm has your answer!

Source: The Publisher Website.

101732.name: American McGee's Grimm: Episode 20 – Pinocchio
101732.description:
Contrary to popular belief, Pinocchio’s story isn’t just about extendable noses and talking crickets. This is the tale of a demonic puppet, driven by greed and jealousy; he lies, cheats, steals, kills and then lies some more. Watch out Pinocchio, Grimm isn’t one for sharing the spotlight!

Source: The Publisher Website.

101733.name: American McGee's Grimm: Episode 21 – Sleeping Beauty
101733.description:
A socially awkward witch lays a nasty curse which sends everyone to the land of slumber for One-hundred years. One-hundred years is a very long time. It’s an especially long nap time. Grimm has a few tricks up his sleeve fill the time in this episode, the longest one yet!

Source: The Publisher Website.

101734.name: American McGee's Grimm: Episode 22 – The Adventures of Tumbling
101734.description:
This week sees a compilation of Thumbling’s most interesting adventures. Join him as he flees from home, then flees his first job, then the circus, then… the Vikings? Includes a bonus lesson on equine anatomy. Another day at the office for Grimm? We’ll see.

Source: The Publisher Website.

101735.name: American McGee's Grimm: Episode 23 – Snow White
101735.description:
The (step)mother of all fairy tales rounds out our third and final season. Surely Grimm won’t go quietly. Join him as tries an alternative lifestyle, reunites with old “friends” and even discovers some lost relatives! Epic!

Source: The Publisher Website.

101736.name: Star Ship
videogameversion: Android (Atari Greatest Hits Atari 2600 Emulation) edition
101736.description:
Game Manual

STAR SHIP

You're sitting in your Star Ship cockpit. And your television screen is suddenly transformed into the window of your Star Ship. Steer the ship deep into space. A constant barrage of meteors whiz toward your window. Eerie Enemy Space Objects float from the darkest parts of space.

Your mission in space is to destroy Enemy Space Objects to score points. You are helpless against asteroids -- they can NOT be destroyed. Lose one point when an Enemy Space Object or asteroid crashes into your ship.

Two-Player Games

You are sitting in your Star Ship cockpit. Use the right Joystick Controller to guide the Star Ship. The opponent uses the other Joystick Controller to steer the Space Module that appears through the Space Window.

As Module Commander, you must avoid collisions and laser missiles from the Star Ship. The Module's main defense? The ability to become invisible.

WARP DRIVE

You are sitting in your cockpit watching space whiz by. Steer your ship past the indestructible asteroids. Your mission? To cover as much distance as possible.

Your space meter ticks away each parsec (a measure of space distance which equals 19.2 trillion miles) of distance in the upper right corner of the Space Window. You lose one parsec each time you collide with an asteroid.

LUNAR LANDER

You've explored space. Now your mission is to explore the moon. You control the Lunar Lander on the Space Window with your Controller Joystick. The game or another player controls the movement of the moon. Score one point for every successful landing your Lunar Lander makes.

One-Player Games

Each one-player game lasts 2 minutes and 16 seconds. The computer controls the movement of the moon. You control the movement of the Lunar Lander. Score one point for every successful landing your Lander makes.

Two-Player Games

Control the Lunar Lander with the right Joystick. The other player controls the moon with the left Joystick. Only the Lunar Lander Commander can score one point for each successful moon landing.

The two-player games last 4 minutes and 32 seconds. After the first half of the game, the Lunar Lander changes from blue to orange, and the right Joystick controls the moon's movement; the left Joystick then controls the Lunar Lander. That way, both players have a chance to score.

101737.name: Angry Birds: The Card Game
101737.description:
This game one of the many games in the Angry Birds Series.

From the manufacturer:

"The survival of the Angry Birds is at stake. Be the first person to strategically topple the structure cards by rolling the right bird on the die. Then knock out the pigs with the flick of a die to win in this quick-play game based on the super popular phone app. Includes Angry Birds playing cards and Dice. For 2 to 5 players."

Angry Birds: The Card Game is similar to the popular video game currently available on a multitude of platforms. Players will be using their bird cards to try and knock out the object cards and save the eggs. After the object cards are gone, the first player to knock over the King Pig by shooting with a die wins!

101738.name: Monster Truck Madness 2
101738.description:
Monster Truck Madness 2 (abbreviated as MTM2, codenamed "Metal Crush 2") is a monster truck racing PC game developed by Terminal Reality and published by Microsoft Games, in 1998.

Source: Wikipedia, "Monster Truck Madness 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101739.name: Star Wars: Return of the Jedi – Death Star Battle
videogameversion: UK ZX Spectrum compact cassette release
101739.description:
Back of Box

Just when you thought the DEATH STAR had been reduced to dust--it's making a comeback! Piece by piece, the Empire's reconstructing the ultimate space station. Its completion would mean unthinkable power for the Imperial forces!

The DEATH STAR must be destroyed...once and for all!

Grab hold of the controls and guide the MILLENNIUM FALCON through one of the ever-changing openings in the force field. Blast the TIE INTERCEPTORS left and right before they open fire on you! Plus, keep an eye on the Death Ray as it tracks your ship. One direct hit and you're a goner! Fire away at the DEATH STAR! Wear it down with your missiles--and POW--the DEATH STAR's history! A cool head and a steady hand are a MUST if you're to succeed in this mission!

101740.description:
Saloon Fights is an Old West themed game that attempts to recreate the saloon fights as they occurred in Hollywood movies. This game isn't meant to be a realistic portrayal of fights, rather it portrays the over-the-top fights of B-grade cinema. Each player in the group controls a group of six, one is a group of hardworking cowhands and the other is a group of ne’erdowells looking for trouble.

The game map is a hex grid of the saloon and the wooden sidewalk outside. Objects inside the saloon such as tables and the bar also represented which serve as movement obstacles to the players. There are a total of three maps included with the game.

Each player has 50 points which are allocated to the six men either as strength points or dexterity points before the fight begins. Fighting is carried out in order of descending dexterity (highest dexterity goes first). The men can be hurt, knocked unconscious, stunned, or killed and the game provides counters to indicate their status during the fight. The fight is initiated between two randomly chosen men who must throw the first punch at each other before any other characters can join in.

The game includes counters for townsfolk such as piano players, saloon girls, and the bartender, each of whom has strength and dexterity characteristics and may get involved in the fight. The game turns are timed based on the camera cuts of old Western movies.
101740.name: Saloon Fights

101741.name: Sub-Scan
101741.description:
Game Manual

Now hear this! Now hear this! All hands man your battle stations.

Enemy submarines have been detected in your waters. You command a destroyer which can launch as many as four depth charges at a time. Your mission is to sink as many enemy subs as possible.

But it’s not that simple. Because Sub-Scan is more than a shooting match. It’s a game of strategy. A battle of wits. Can-and-mouse on the high seas between the hunter above and the hunted below.

101742.description:
Men of Bronze takes the Steel and Glory system to the world of Steampunk. The game pits two groups against each others, one called Sky Patrol and one called The Masters of Terror. The game includes several characters from each faction and includes scenarios for large group battles and man-to-man fights.

The game uses a points system to buy characters with. Players have 40 points to spend on their heroes and villains in order to build the best group. The game follows the core rules of the other Steel and Glory games but adds new rules to accommodate the new Steampunk fighting techniques.

Each turn, players activate a character which can take up to two actions, including fight, move, rest, climb, or stand/go prone. Characters can attack enemies that are one square away for melee attack or may use ranged attack for enemies further away. Fighting is based on power of the weapon, power of the character's attack strength, and power of the enemies defense strike. The hit points are calculated via 2D6 - the power of the attack. For example, if an attack had a total strength of 6 and a 10 was rolled, the attack would have a power of 4. Victory is achieved by having a character remain on a certain part of the board for three complete uninterrupted turns.
101742.name: Men of Bronze

101743.name: Multiverse Jumpers
101743.description:
Remember Quantum Leap and Sliders? Maybe reading the Exiles series from Marvel Comics? Well this were it's at The game is a 3-5 players co-op where players work together to get back to their home dimension (Earth Prime). To do so they must split their forces between completing missions for/against historical figures encountered in alternate worlds and repairing the Navigator, a device that may lead them home... at least before it's out of power.

Introduction:
…You just woke up... the last thing you remember is being on that late night bus, slipping in and out of consciousness, rocked by the vibrations of the almost retired vehicle. Then you’re here, wherever that may be, everything looks strange but familiar, like looking through a cracked mirror. The other passengers are here too, and they found a device they say can take you all home. How do they know? Who knows indeed? It’s worth a shot, anyway you’re not liking the sounds of whatever is approaching.

You and the others have fallen through the dimensions that make the multiverse, an infinity of alternate realities where the best utopias and the worst nightmares can be found. The strange device you found, this "Navigator", seems to be the key to get home. But it doesn’t seem in good shape. Was it damaged before, is it the cause of your being here, is it some sort of test? All you know is that the batteries are fading fast and you and your fellow multiverse castaways better fix it and find your home dimension before you stay stranded forever...

Aim of the game:
Players must work together to complete the missions set by the Navigator on each world they land and repair the Navigator along the way to ensure that they make it back to their home dimension: Earth Prime. Each turn, the players will encounter a historical figure in a new dimension where things are different and must somehow be righted: a ruthless Benjamin Franklin has sided with the machines to destroy mankind and must be stopped, a benevolent Genghis Khan needs help surviving in a dying world... those are but a few of the thousands of possible missions the players will have to complete before going home.

Gameplay:
Each player receives a character card, indicating their strengths and weaknesses along five stats (Status, Fight, Intellect, Stealth and Tech). Each turn, by revealing one of each Alternate World, Target and Mission cards, the players get to face one of over 25000 challenges. As a group, they decide who will attempt the mission and pool their relevant stats to form the mission dice pool. Scoring more successes than the target in the contest set by the Mission card will allow the other players to repair the Navigator device. It's up to the players to assess their chances against various challenges and decide when to use the precious power left in the Navigator until they reveal the Earth Prime card hidden among 29 Alternate World cards to win the game. However the players can lose the game if the Navigator runs out of power or if they run out of World cards.

101745.description:
Samuel Brown is an official entry to the Heroscape collection. He was approved, tested and designed back before D&D Heroscape came out.

Character Bio (From Colby Dauch designer): "A while back Wizards asked us to design a couple of potential repaint exclusives. We made Agent Skahen and one other. The other was a patriot by the name of Samuel Brown and he was never used. We recently asked Wizards for permission to release the card and were granted permission."

Samuel Brown can be made by converting one of the figures of the 4th Massachusetts squad available in the Utgar's Rage "Minutemen and Wolves" pack.
101745.name: Heroscape: Samuel Brown
boardgameexpansion: Heroscape Master Set: Rise of the Valkyrie
Heroscape Master Set: Swarm of the Marro

101746.name: Command & Conquer 3 (Limited Collection)
101746.description:
User Summary

Command & Conquer 3 (Limited Collection) (named Command & Conquer 3 (Deluxe Edition) in Europe) is a compilation of Command & Conquer 3: Tiberium Wars and its expansion: Command & Conquer 3: Kane's Wrath

videogame: Age of Empires III: The WarChiefs
101747.name: Age of Empires III (Gold Edition)
videogamecompilation: Age of Empires III: The WarChiefs
101747.description:
User Summary

Age of Empires III (Gold Edition) is a compilation of Age of Empires III and its first expansion, The WarChiefs.

101748.name: Command & Conquer: Assault Pack
videogamehonor: 1998 D.I.C.E. Strategy Game of the Year Nominee (Computer)
101748.description:
User Summary

This compilation (also known as "Command & Conquer GOLD Bundle") contains both Command & Conquer and its expansion, Command & Conquer: The Covert Operations.
While the game play of the original game remains untouched, this compilation boats improved graphics.

101749.name: Command & Conquer: Red Alert 3 Bundle
101749.description:
User Summary

This compilation contains both Command & Conquer: Red Alert 3 and its add-on pack: Command & Conquer: Red Alert 3 - Uprising.

101750.name: Command & Conquer: Sole Survivor
101750.description:
Command & Conquer: Sole Survivor was a multiplayer spinoff of the original Command & Conquer game. It featured a deathmatch-style game in which each player controls a unit of the original Command & Conquer game and travels around the game arena collecting crates to increase this unit's firepower, armor, speed, attack range and reloading speed. Sole Survivor was often compared to a first-person shooter, however played with a top-down perspective of the arena. It featured no single-player mode and the multiplayer had no hints of a storyline, and was omitted from inclusion in the Command & Conquer: The First Decade compilation pack.

Source: Wikipedia, "Command & Conquer: Tiberian series", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101751.name: Command & Conquer: Theater of War
101751.description:
User Summary

This Command & Conquer collection includes the original four Command & Conquer Games: Command & Conquer, Command & Conquer: Red Alert, Command & Conquer: Tiberian Sun and Command & Conquer: Red Alert 2. However, it does not contain any of the many expansions or add-ons for any of these four games.

videogame: Command & Conquer: Red Alert – The Aftermath
101752.name: Command & Conquer: Worldwide Warfare
videogamecompilation: Command & Conquer: Red Alert – The Aftermath
101752.description:
User Summary

This compilation contains the first two Command & Conquer games (Command & Conquer and Command & Conquer: Red Alert) as well as add-ons/expansions for both.

101753.name: Command & Conquer: Tiberian Sun – Firepower
101753.description:
User Summary

This compilation includes Command & Conquer: Tiberian Sun, its add-on pack: Command & Conquer: Tiberian Sun – Firestorm as well as a soundtrack from the game.

101754.name: Game & Watch Gallery
101754.description:
User Summary

Game & Watch Gallery is compilation of four Nintendo handheld games. The games can be played in two modes, classic and modern. The four games included are Octopus, Fire, Manhole, and Oil Panic.

101755.name: Command & Conquer: Generals (Deluxe Edition)
101755.description:
User Summary

This compilation includes both Command & Conquer: Generals and its expansion: Command & Conquer: Generals Zero Hour. Also included are a two sided poster of the various races, units and buildings in the game and Command and Conquer Generals World Builder; an application allowing players to create their own custom missions and maps.

videogame: Quake II Mission Pack: Ground Zero
Quake II Mission Pack: The Reckoning
Quake Mission Pack 1: Scourge of Armagon
Quake Mission Pack 2: Dissolution of Eternity
101756.name: The Quake Collection
videogamecompilation: Quake II Mission Pack: Ground Zero
Quake II Mission Pack: The Reckoning
Quake Mission Pack 1: Scourge of Armagon
Quake Mission Pack 2: Dissolution of Eternity
101756.description:
User Summary

This downloadable compilation of Quake games is available through Steam. The collection includes Quake, Quake II, Quake III: Arena and add-ons for each.

101757.name: Ultimate Quake
101757.description:
User Summary

Ultimate Quake collects the first three Quake titles - Quake, Quake II and Quake III: Arena - into one compilation.

101758.name: Maya Pyramid
101758.description:
Maya Pyramid is a card game that has some similarity to the "Pyramid" Solitaire game. As the name suggests, the game entails that players form card pyramids. However, the groups of cards used to form pyramids have to add up to 11. The game uses a deck of 42 cards and 1 joker. The functions look extremely straightforward at a glance, but the game has its own intriguing points. The game requires players to dismantle a set of 24 - 26 cards as quickly as possible. The 24 - 26 cards are face up and another set of help cards are face down. The trick is the more cards that players can dismantle without using the set of help cards, the more points they will score.

Source: The Game Website.

101759.name: Nimxus
101759.description:
This is game #16 in the Games on Half a Checkerboard Series.

Nimxus is in the Nim family. It has a unique feature where players can be forced to place pieces in a column or row, based upon how many pieces their opponent played. Each turn, players place 1-4 pieces on the board. This number, 1-4 corresponds with the number or row the player's opponent put pieces in. Each player has their own unique row, while sharing a column.

Play continues until a player has no legal move. At that point, that player wins the game.

101760.name: Boxing the Fox
101760.description:
This is game #17 in the Games on Half a Checkerboard Series

This is a game in the Fox family of games, which includes Fox and Hounds, where the object is for the Fox player to escape, and the Hound player to stop them. In the game, the Fox player faces an onslaught of Hound pieces, that merely rush forward, and then can recycle if they form a line, and then keep pouring in from the top of the board.

101761.name: Contiguous Collapse
101761.description:
This is game #18 in the Games on Half a Checkerboard Series

In this game, players alternate turns moving and capturing an enemy piece, while avoiding a cascade effect that could result in a number of their own contiguously connected pieces being eliminated during their turn.

Play starts out with players alternating turns placing one of their pieces on the board. Once each player has placed their 12 pieces on the board, play begins, with each player attempting to capture an enemy piece while avoiding removal of their own pieces in the same turn.

The flow of the game is one that starts out very strategic in nature, then shifts to a very tactical one in the second half.

101762.name: L-Gammon
101762.description:
This is game #19 in the Games on Half a Checkerboard Series

This game is a variant on Backgammon adopted to an 8x4 board and in two dimensions. The name comes from the the L-type shape that the movement of pieces resemble during their turn.

Play is similar to regular Backgammon, except that spaces on the board can totally block the movement of enemy pieces, unless doubles are rolled. In addition, pieces start off the board in a reserve, and enter the board through a player's a home space, as game progresses. Besides this, when pieces are hit, they are sent back to the reserve area, rather than a bar (L-Gammon doesn't utilize a bar). A player only bears off pieces when they have none in their reserve.

The game has the feel of regular backgammon, but the 2 dimensions adds increased tactical considerations.

101763.name: Ordigo
101763.description:
This is game #20 in the Games on Half a Checkerboard Series

In this game, players alternate turns placing one or more pieces on the board, in attempt to be the first to gain control over at least half the board. Players have the ability to place more than one piece by placing pieces adjacent to one of their own and enemy pieces currently on the board, or surrounded a space that is either empty or containing one of their opponent's pieces.

101764.name: Imperium of Man
101764.description:
Imperium of Man is a solitaire card game set in the Warhammer 40K universe. The player represents the Human Empire who must defeat all enemy units from the alien worlds: Chaos, Eldar, Tyranids, Orks, Necrons, and Tau. There is also 1 Internal Foe: Rebel Worlds.

Each turn in the game contains 10 phases. In these phases, new enemies are spawned, random events happen, new tech is built, and battles are fought. Battles are fought by rolling a D10 and applying any modifiers from built technology. A modified roll of 6+ is a hit for both the enemy aliens and the Human Empire. The player has a supply of Empire Points which grow throughout the game. These points can be used to absorb hits when no Empire Units are left on the battlefield. The Empire Points aslo affect the number of new units that the player can recruit each round.

To win, the player must eliminate all enemy unit. The final score is the number of turns it took to eliminate them. The game is lost if the player loses all Empire Points before eliminating the enemies.

101765.name: Georgia Skin
101765.description:
Georgia Skin is a game that has to be seen to be believed. When it's played by professional gamblers, you see it but you don't believe it! All cards are dealt face up. Players bet against the dealer and against each other. What they're betting on is that the face up card in front of the player they are betting against will be matched (paired) before their face up card is matched. That's all! Rank and suit of cards have no meaning in Georgia Skin ... and no one has an advantage. It's a dead-even gamble. Player with the most money is the winner.

Components:

1 Felt game mat
2 Standard decks of playing cards
1 Set of play money
1 Best Little Book Ever Written About Poker

101766.description:
2- 4 Players compete to build and mine slate in North Wales.

Players roll three dice to determine what actions they can take, though money can be spent to alter the die roll. Actions available to players include building a mine, selling slate or take a development action. The development actions either benefit players in the final scoring or allow players to add to their stock, adjust a die or improve the return from the sell slate action.

At the end of the game players score points for developments, mines owned and money


'Slate' is second game in Martin Wallace's series of four designed for the 2011 issues of Spielbox (included in Edition 93. The game requires the materials provided in issue 3 of Spielbox 2011.

The first game in the Series is 'Great Western'
101766.name: Slate

101767.name: Zeit der Zünfte
101767.description:
The game was one of the titles in the final round of the "Hippodice Spieleautorenwettbewerb 2010".

The players try to get the most profitable contracts in this competition. But which player is playing for which guild? This secret is only revealed at the end of the game!

During each turn, the player rolls a d6 and places a matching numbered tile on a six-sided guild space. The game ends, when all 24 numbered tiles are placed on the game board. Depending on the chosen spaces and the value of the numbered tiles, different guilds will score victory points.

101768.name: Voyage en France
101768.description:
Voyage en France is the same game as Journey through Europe, Deutschlandreise or Weltreise.

Each player receives some destination cards with places in France. The players have to move along the board by throwing a die. The first player who has visited all of his/her destination cards and arrives back in the starting place wins the game.

101769.name: Keine Mark zuviel
101769.description:
Merchandising game

Players have to roll dice, move meeples over the board and reach target spots in order to get Bargain cards.

101770.name: West Point: Extra Planetary Academy
101770.description:
From the back of the book:

WestPoint; space cadets of the far future
Probably the hardest dilemmas that you can roleplay
Enter a new kind of role-playing system fro equilibrium Games
Play in a familiar environment, breaking new ground
Attend West Point if you have what it takes!

101771.name: Gonna get Yer
101771.description:
This is a simple roll and move game. Up to four players try to get their three pieces all the way around the board, avoiding the monster on the way.

The monster travels a track around the middle of the board. He doesn't move until the first six is rolled, after which he will move every time the dice is rolled BEFORE the player who rolled the dice moves the same number of spaces.

Players can choose to travel the shorter dangerous path, or take safer longer routes, so there is a small amount of risk management involved.

The game makes use of a "popper" built into the centre of the board that is depressed to roll the dice.

From the back of the box:

A fun and tense family game for 2 to 4 players. Can you get round the board without getting eaten by the monster? One false move and the monster's gonna get yer!

CONTENTS:
Playing board with centre dice-popper.
12 playing pieces (three each in four colours).
Monster.
Instructions leaflet.

101772.name: Early Words
101772.description:
A simple word game in which you make words of four letters or more using 112 letter cards.

Cards are drawn from a deck, until someone can make a word. The player sets that word aside and it will count towards his or her final score. Play then continues in the same manner, but if someone can create a new word by adding newly drawn letter cards to a word someone else has already made, then that word is stolen. More complicated words are harder to make but are more difficult to steal.

The first player to make a prearranged number of words (either by making them with "free" letters from the card deck or by adding to words already in play, thereby stealing them), is the winner.

From the box:

Deriving from one of the oldest word construction games, Early Words is the fastest, the most skilful and the most cunning.

101774.name: Crazy Harry
101774.description:
If you like games where a player suddenly sticks his tongue out to another player, where another player answers by flapping like a bird and where the players growl, squeak and grunt; where they moo, break wind(oops!) and pull their noses, then you'll love Crazy Harry, an outrageous card game with simple rules.

gameplay:
One by one each player puts a card down on a stack in the middle with 2 drawings one them. The player who puts the card down chooses which drawing he impersonates and the other player must do the other one. If a player misses or is to soon, he must take the complete stack. their are a few exceptions like the fish (only the fish gets impersonated) and crazy harry (everybody must lay his hand on the stack, the player whose hand is on top, must take the stack). The player with no cards left, wins

with: 55 playing cards

101775.name: Journey to the Planets
101775.description:
Back of the Box

What is your favourite type of game; space, arcade or adventure? "Journey to the Planets" presents and intriguing combination of all three as you find yourself on a strange planet in a strange universe. Luckily the local gods are friendly and provide you with energy, a space-ship and weaponry. In return you agree to search the universe for treasures for the gods. Board your ship, take off, and accelerate through the upper atmosphere and out into space. Your flight should take you past many other inviting planets. With a slow approach and skilled maneuvering, you drop down through the planet's sky to a soft landing on its surface. Disembark and wander through several TV screens full of mystery and excitement. A different adventure awaits you on each planet.

101776.name: The Guy Game
101776.description:
From the back of the box:

The Guy Game puts you in the world's wildest party spot for the steamiest Spring Break action ever! Shot live at South Padre Island, this Red-Hot Trivia Challenge lets you play with over 60 smokin' coeds during Spring Break insanity, as they proudly show off their "assets" for your personal enjoyment. You bring the party and we'll supply the game—YOU'LL SCORE EVERY TIME!

101777.name: ParaWorld
videogamedeveloper: Sunflowers Interactive Entertainment Software GmbH (Sunflowers GmbH)
101777.description:
ParaWorld is a real-time strategy PC game released on September 25, 2006. It was developed by the German company SEK (Spieleentwicklungskombinat), based in Berlin. The game features more than 50 prehistoric animals, especially dinosaurs and Pleistocene mammals. The game uses TAGES, and therefore installs a driver on the system for copy protection.

The game-concept is similar to "Age of Empires", which is a real-time strategy game. ParaWorld features food, wood, and stone as resources. Food can be picked from bushes, hunted from animals, fished from the sea, or farmed. Stone is located in limited deposits, and wood, cut from trees, is generally scattered throughout a map. Battles can occur on both land and sea.

The story takes place in a parallel dimension, where prehistoric life thrives alongside diverse human civilizations that are technologically not too far. As a result, dinosaurs take the place of traditional wildlife and livestock, though some of the dinosaurs in-game are highly stylized and not necessarily scientifically accurate. Wild-living dinosaurs can be hunted for food, though some are of dangerous and aggressive species and will attack any player unit that wanders too close. Other prehistoric creatures make an appearance as well, for example woolly mammoths are used where other games might feature elephants.

Players advance through epochs in order to unlock new technologies and upgrades.

Source: Wikipedia, "ParaWorld", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101780.name: The Tome of Horrors Complete (Pathfinder Version)
101780.description:
From the publisher's website:

The Tome of Horrors? But that’s been done already; why do it again? Well, actually it’s been done three times, but never like this. With the advent of the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game as the newest torchbearer for the world’s most popular role-playing game, we need monsters—lots of monsters. That’s where The Tome of Horrors Complete delivers in spades. Starting from the original Tome written with the 3rd Edition rules along with the later releases of Tomes 2 and 3 for version 3.5, Necromancer Games was in the unique position to bring you updates of the classic monsters not formally released by the OGL, as well as, loads of new ones never sprung upon unsuspecting players before. So well received have these monsters been by the gaming community, that this open content has appeared again and again in game publications by other companies including updates to the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game system and even appearances in its own bestiaries.

Why stop there? Never before have all three volumes been updated to the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game in their entirety and released as a single, hardbound tome. Monsters from the aberrant to the yellow musk zombie appear in this book, and everything in between—that’s over 700 monsters. But that’s not all; the appendices bring just as much to the table from templates to hazards to a treatise on poison variations in nearly 50 types of venomous snakes. There are also new feats, planes of existence, strange beings beyond mortal ken, and plenty of charts dividing the compiled monsters by CR, type, and terrain.

So you’ve got the monsters—both from the original edition of the game and new,—the templates, the multiple appendices on rules, planes, and the n’gathau, and a truckload of sample encounters and lairs to throw at your players, all together in one easy-to-use book. That’s why we call it The Tome of Horrors Complete!

Note: There are two versions of this book, this one which is for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game and another one for the Swords & Wizardry rules.

101781.name: The Tome of Horrors Complete (Swords & Wizardry)
101781.description:
From the publisher's website:

The Tome of Horrors? But that’s been done already; why do it again? Well, actually it’s been done three times, but never like this. With the advent of the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game as the newest torchbearer for the world’s most popular role-playing game, we need monsters—lots of monsters. That’s where The Tome of Horrors Complete delivers in spades. Starting from the original Tome written with the 3rd Edition rules along with the later releases of Tomes 2 and 3 for version 3.5, Necromancer Games was in the unique position to bring you updates of the classic monsters not formally released by the OGL, as well as, loads of new ones never sprung upon unsuspecting players before. So well received have these monsters been by the gaming community, that this open content has appeared again and again in game publications by other companies including updates to the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game system and even appearances in its own bestiaries.

Why stop there? Never before have all three volumes been updated to the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game in their entirety and released as a single, hardbound tome. Monsters from the aberrant to the yellow musk zombie appear in this book, and everything in between—that’s over 700 monsters. But that’s not all; the appendices bring just as much to the table from templates to hazards to a treatise on poison variations in nearly 50 types of venomous snakes. There are also new feats, planes of existence, strange beings beyond mortal ken, and plenty of charts dividing the compiled monsters by CR, type, and terrain.

But it’s more than just that, because the entire compilation has also been updated to the Swords & Wizardry rules for release as another version of the volume. And in this version, the space freed up by the smaller stat blocks is filled by sample monster lairs and encounters with the hundreds of different monster types featured in the tome. Never before has this massive selection of monsters been updated and brought with these resources all together in one place for use in your own game.

So you’ve got the monsters—both from the original edition of the game and new,—the templates, the multiple appendices on rules, planes, and the n’gathau, and a truckload of sample encounters and lairs to throw at your players, all together in one easy-to-use book. That’s why we call it The Tome of Horrors Complete!

Note: There are two versions of this book, this one which is for the Swords & Wizardry rules, and another one for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. Pre-orders close June 30, with the book shipping August 2011.

101782.name: Risk II (fan adaptation of Risk)
101782.description: Taken from the rules of the PC game of the same name, Risk II is played much like classic Risk. The goal is still world domination, battle resolutions are based on the luck of dice, and the theme remains vaguely Napoleonic. However, there are significant and interesting differences. Most important is the use of simultaneous planning and execution of attacks. Players write down their plans, and once revealed, battles are resolved in a prescribed fashion. Also of note is the addition of several territories and connection points, changing the values of continents and making them more difficult to hold; yes, gone are the days of establishing an easy bastion in Australia. The dice rules are significantly different, using 12-sided dice of various strength. And still, there are other alterations that change the nature of the game, yet it retains the flavor of Risk. Simply put, you are still playing Risk, but you no longer have to wait an hour between turns before you can play again; now it is always your turn.

101783.description:
Description from the publisher:

Officially an "international liason" for the Shōgunate, Mizu Kage prefers to conduct her diplomacy with Willow and Winding Stream, her deadly sai blades. She has twice saved "the Daimyo" from certain death and three times taken down misguided Reich soldiers who thought to betray their tentative alliance with the Shōgunate. Now charged to collect information that the Shōgunate's Reich allies have been withholding, Mizu works toward the completion of her task like a whisper of wind through the night trees.

With her sai, shuriken, and happo, she can decide to tread a path of blood or conduct an infiltration, unseen and unheard. As a member of the Shōgunate, Mizu may partner with forces from the Reich, according to the Nippon Accords, or she may feature in a team made exclusively from Shōgunate characters.
101783.name: Tannhäuser: Mizu
boardgameexpansion: Tannhäuser

boardgamehonor: 2012 Golden Geek Best Thematic Board Game Nominee
2012 Golden Geek Most Innovative Board Game Nominee
101785.description:
Normandy, June 6th, 1944 – as you land on the well-defended beaches, a German machine gun nest is killing your comrades like flies. You must do something!

In D-Day Dice, players are Allied soldiers trying to organize improvised units for an attack against the machine gun nest. Each player starts the game with a unit of a few soldiers and nothing else. As the game progresses, he will collect resources and advance on the beach, sector by sector, as his unit grows stronger and deadlier. He will succeed...or die trying.

D-Day Dice is a multiplayer co-op game, where all players play their turn simultaneously and must help each other in order to stay alive. It also includes solitaire optional rules. Although built around dice rolling, this game is about resource management (soldiers, specialists, items and courage) and knowing when to move your unit. Resources are kept from turn to turn, so the players can plan ahead.

Note: This listing is for the commercial version of D-Day Dice. To download and play the game now, go to D-Day Dice: Free Trial Version.

Expanded by 3 marketed expansions:

D-Day Dice: Operation Neptune
D-Day Dice: Atlantikwall
D-Day Dice: Normandy

boardgameimplementation: Dust Tactics: Allied Taskforce Joe Starter Set
Dust Tactics: SSU Battlegroup Koshka Starter Set
101786.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Get ready to fight the war anew! The Dust Tactics: Revised Core Set is the perfect introduction for new players or a great expansion for veterans. It includes all new, never-before-released miniatures exclusive to this Core Set, an updated and comprehensive rulebook, the "Victory Bridge" scenario book, six custom dice, two double-sided terrain posters (each the size of six terrain tiles), ten unit cards, nine double-sided hazard squares, two ammo-crates, and two anti-tank traps.

The Allies are ready to lay waste to their Axis foes with their new forces. Meanwhile, the Blutkreuz Korps refuse to be bested on any field of battle. Their new Axis troops are equally powerful. With astonishing abilities and firepower, it will be a struggle deciding which side you want to fight for.

The included terrain posters unique to the Revised Core Set introduce Dust Tactics players to new terrain elements featured in the "Victory Bridge" scenario book. These terrain posters are a new warfare experience due to the new environment they offer players: a bridge and building structures, as well as new terrain symbols. The "Victory Bridge" scenario book offers players six never-before-seen scenarios with which they can carry out a campaign. England's Cobden Bridge has suddenly become the strategic location for gaining access to Southampton. Can your faction take control of the bridge, and gain the advantage of advancing into southern England?

101787.name: Butterfly Stop
101787.description:
The whole carddeck are distributed among the players.
The players play the top card of their hand in the center of the table face-up. Whenever the "Butterfly stop" card is played the one who played it must exclaims "Butterfly stop" and is entitled to all the cards that have been played, but in case he omits to do so before the next card has been played, the cards must remain on the table.
At the end of the game the player holding the greatest number of cards scores 5 points.The one holding the card "Regal Silver Wing" scores 3 points and all the other butterfly cards scores 1 point each. Player with the most points is the winner.

101788.name: Dust Tactics: Unit Card Upgrade Pack
boardgameexpansion: Dust Tactics
Dust Tactics: Revised Core Set
101788.description:
Description from the publisher:

With the intimidating forces of the rival bloc spread out on the battlefield before you, what kind of army will you build?

Gather your forces with the Dust Tactics: Unit Card Upgrade Pack! The affordable Dust Tactics: Unit Card Upgrade Pack includes unit cards for all the units released before Operation "SeeLöwe" including unit cards for all preview miniatures available from Dust Tactics Game Night kits.

Dust Tactics' previously published unit cards have been reprinted in the Dust Tactics: Unit Card Upgrade Pack and have been updated to the new army point costs featured in the Revised Core Set.

101789.name: Dust Tactics: Terrain Tile Set
boardgameexpansion: Dust Tactics
Dust Tactics: Revised Core Set
101789.description:
Description from the publisher:

The Dust Tactics: Terrain Tile Set includes twelve double-sided terrain tiles (and more!) to expand your Dust Tactics map library. These exciting components feature snow, warehouse, water, and bridge locations on which your Dust Tactics troops can wage their war. The Dust Tactics: Terrain Tile Set also includes the Operation: Blue Thunder campaign book found in the original Core Set. There are eight scenarios featured in the campaign book as well as three bonus scenarios to play on massive maps that are twelve tiles large.

This expansion allows new Dust Tactics players to experience the scenarios available in the original Dust Tactics Core Set. Players who own the original Dust Tactics Core Set will be able to expand their experience with the additional locations found on these terrain tiles and the three bonus scenarios. Further, the included double-sided structure tiles allow your forces to battle in an urban environment, recently an experience only available through Operation "SeeLöwe".

101790.name: Object, Action, Creature
101790.description:
In this game teams compete to collect one card from each of three categories (Object, Action, and Creature).

Each member of a team brings 5 items (together the items must all fit in the palms of the hands of the person who brought the items) and those items are then used as props for that team.

On a turn a member of a team rolls the die, draws a card, and then using the props for the team (those items which each member of the team brought) attempts to get the other players of the team to guess the word on the card that corresponds to the roll of the die.

If a team fails to guess the word, the other team(s) have an opportunity to guess the word and steal the card from the team.

The first team to collect an Object card, an Action card, and a Creature card wins the game.

101791.name: Centre
101791.description:
An abstract two-player strategy game, CENTRE (formally SPOOLS) has only a few basic rules of play that combine neatly with the unique design of the board to produce a new and different game.

By positioning and relocating pieces, players attempt to maneuver their own Emperor to the center circle of the board -- aided by their four Defenders and four Marauders, each of which possesses specific movement and attack capabilities.

Another unique aspect of the game is the one-way interaction between pieces: Defenders may attack only Marauders, Marauders may attack only Emperors, and Emperors may attack only Defenders and Marauders.

101792.name: Namco Museum
videogameversion: JP Game Boy Advance (Value Selection) edition
101792.description:
From the US box back

"You don't have to be an iron man to carry around the greatest arcade games of all time.

Keep your quarters in your pants and your favorite arcade games too. Namco Museum for the Game Boy Advance puts some of the greatest coin-op classics such as Ms. Pac-Man, Galaxian, Pole Position, Galaga, and Dig Dug into the palm of your hand.

Now history repeats itself.

Just like the original arcade uprights, Namco Museum features genuine graphics, sound effects and gameplay, but now you can change settings to control the number of lives, difficulty level and goals for advancing.

It's a blast from the past.

Retro gaming is back and it's bigger, uh... smaller than ever. Just like an arcade, but without the chewing gum stuck to the machine."

101793.description:
User Summary

North Star Games made this personality card with 7 of Bruno Faidutti´s favorite questions.
101793.name: Wits & Wagers: Bruno Faidutti Personality Card Promo
boardgameexpansion: Wits & Wagers

101794.name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (2003)
101794.description:
From the back of the US GameCube edition case

"Prepare for ninja kick-butt fighting as you face the Shredder and his vile pack of Foot Ninjas!

Team up in the Story Mode for a single or 2-player co-operative game.

Kick some ninja-butt with cool combos and special attack.

Go head-to-head in the VS mode."

101795.name: C64 Classix
videogamecompilation: Barney Brown and the Chicago Connection
Metagalactic Llamas: Battle at the Edge of Time
Robin of Sherwood: The Touchstones of Rhiannon
101795.description:
User Summary

C64 Classix is a compilation of 520 original Commodore 64 games for Windows and OS X. The games is in the categories: action (100 games), adventure (77 games), sport (37 games), strategy & mind (47 games) and games by Richard Bayliss (153 games). The disc also includes information about the C64 computer, as well as additional stuff like videos.

All games on C64 CLASSIX are started by assistance of the provided C64 emulator called VICE.

101796.description:
Steeped in Japanese folklore, SUTAKKU was originally developed to teach the common man the foibles of wishing for more than he had.

In this quick-playing, push-your-luck dice game, you attempt to create the tallest stack of dice in order to gain the highest score per turn. To play, roll three dice and add two of them to an ever-climbing stack of dice. You can choose to stop rolling and score your stacked dice at any time, but pushing your luck will net you more points if you succeed. Continue as long as you dare – but like the stonecutter of legend, who was never satisfied, you may find yourself with naught, right back where you began. The wise will distinguish ambition from reaching beyond one's means.
SUTAKKU is beautifully crafted with classic Japanese design aesthetics and features hand-inked brush art characters on premium engraved dice. These twelve dice are ¾" on a side, perfect for stacking. The game also includes a cloth dice bag, stacking board, and scorepad.
101796.name: SUTAKKU
boardgamepodcastepisode: BGA Ep 55 - BGA Court: Gaming vs. Cheating
Episode 8 - Oh The Joy.
Session Impressions: Sutakku
Sutakku with Smirk and Dagger’s Curt Covert
Sutakku with Smirk and Dagger’s Curt Covert

101797.name: Dalton - THE AWESOME!
101797.description:
Play as Dalton on his journey to kill all of the zombies standing in his way as he achieves TRUE AWESOMENESS!

Source: The Developer Website.

User Summary:
This run-and-gun game features stick-figure graphics and tons of weapons and power-ups in a bloody zombie battle.

101798.name: Breitling Reno Air Races The Game
101798.description:
For almost fifty years, the National Championship Air Races, the fastest, most prestigious air races in the world, have been held each September in front of thousands of spectators in Reno, Nevada. In this 5-day event, pilots compete in various categories in courses marked out on the ground by pylons. To win at Reno, it's simple: Fly Low. Go Fast. Turn Left.

As the event's main sponsor, Breitling has created the Breitling Reno Air Races game. Designed for anyone with an iPhone, iPad or iPod, or any mobile device running Android (available as of September 2011), the game lets you discover and enjoy the thrilling races at Reno. Take control of the plane of your choice and pit yourself against others in online multiplayer mode, or on your own in solo mode. This is a unique chance to experience what it's like to fly a plane at the Reno Air Races.

FEATURES

Race in solo mode or multiplayer mode online with up to 8 players via 3G & Wi-Fi
Optimized gyroscopic and touch controls
Reno races and aircraft faithfully recreated in full 3D
Choose your plane and customize it
Available in English, French, Spanish, German, Italian and Portuguese
Compatible with OpenFeint and Apple Game Center
Already available for iPhone, iPad and iPod Touch, and available for Android in September 2011




Source: The Game Website.

101799.name: Babel Rising
101799.description:
You are God! From high above in the sky, it appears the humans are bustling about... and building a tower. A tower, what for? To raise themselves to your level? How conceited, how foolhardy. It is time to show them the price to pay for defying the Creator!

FEATURES

Addictive, unlimited and challenging gameplay
Beautiful graphic and sound design
Ergonomics for everyone, easy controls
Include social platform Open Feint (global leader board, 15 achievements)
In app purchase planned for updates (adding new powers to use, new gameplay modes)




Source: The Game Website.

101800.name: Angry Bomb
101800.description:
User Summary

An Angry Birds clone. Hurl different types of bombs against green extraterrestrials to earn points and move on to the next level.

101801.name: Angry Bomb 2
101801.description:
User Summary

Sequel to Angry Bomb. An Angry Birds clone. Hurl different types of bombs against green extraterrestrials to earn points and move on to the next level.

101802.name: Bakery Story
101802.description:
The #1 FREE iPhone and iPad virtual world "Story" series returns with Bakery Story! Design your own dream bakery to show off to your friends. Don't forget to make sure your customers are happy and well-fed by choosing stunning decoration and tasty new pastries! Free content updates so the game continually gets even better!

• Design and build a unique bakery with stunning variety and creativity.
• Customize and choose a top-class menu to suit your tastes.
• Showcase your bakery and earn extra-special tips from friends.
• Invite your Facebook friends to be your neighbors.
• Exchange secret recipes with your friends.
• FREE updates with new pastries, decorations, themes and more!
• It's FREE!

Source: The Developer Website.

101803.name: Grote Schattenjacht
101803.description: this was a promotional game published for maredsous cheese. the purpose of the game is to find the hidden treasure in the abbey of maredsous. to find the treasure you must roll the dice, collect coins and answer questions. the game has 2 stacks of cards. 1 difficult and one easy.

101804.name: Top 13
101804.description:
A game of imagination and insight in which you make up words from the letters that chance brings your way. The multitude of variations that crop up as you play the game make every game go different and exciting.

containing:
13 letter dice (d6)
1 cup
1 timer (1 minute)

One of the players controls the game:
He or she takes charge of throwing the dice and making sure, with the aid of a sand-glass timer, that the players do not overrun the time. To begin the game he puts the timer on the table and throws the thirteen dice. each player, using the letters that turn up on the letter face of the dice, then tries to make a word. each letter has a value which is indicated beside it. The player who, within the allotted time, manages to make the word with the highest score (the sum of all letters used) is the winner.

101805.name: Apple Bandai Pippin
101805.description:
The Pippin is a multimedia platform designed by Apple Inc. (then Apple Computer Inc.) and produced by Bandai in 1995. It was based on a 66 MHz PowerPC 603 processor, a 14.4 kbit/s modem and ran a stripped version of the System 7.5.2 operating system.

The goal was to create an inexpensive computer aimed mostly at playing CD-based multimedia titles, especially games, but also functioning as a network computer. It featured a 4x CD-ROM drive and a video output that could connect to a standard television display.

The platform was named for the Newtown Pippin, an apple cultivar, a smaller and more tart relative of the McIntosh apple.

Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apple_Bandai_Pippin"; available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101806.name: Monster Seed
101806.description:
Monster Seed is a strategy video game released for PlayStation in 1999, developed by NK System and published by SunSoft.

Source: Wikipedia, "Monster Seed", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101807.name: Mission Europa
101807.description:
Story:
You are on your way to your latest search and rescue assignment, the mining outpost on the ice moon Europa. The command center lost contact with the mining facility a few weeks ago. Your crew was sent to investigate and provide necessary technical help. Probably nothing but a bad communication module or power grid said the report. But soon you find out that things are not what they seem to be. Soon you will have to fight for survival and sanity. Soon you will face death. But will you find the answers?

About:
In development for over a year, Mission Europa is a new product from BansheeSoft, headed by gaming industry veteran Ryan Mitchell. Mission Europa uses the latest version of iOS optimized proprietary 3D SouL_EnginE. The game engine was developed by BansheeSoft over two years and it supports all iOS devices going back to the original iPhone.

Gameplay:
Mission Europa is a amazing mix of first person shooter and a role playing game. It merges intense action, immersive storyline, deep character development and hours of gameplay.

Features:
- Over 50 hours of gameplay
- 5 episodes with over 170 missions to complete. All episodes included in the Collector's Edition.
- Custom proprietary 3D SouL_EnginE optimized for iOS device
- Over 50 levels to explore
- Over 180 enemies and monsters
- Over 50 enemy bosses
- Over 15 original armor sets in Standard Edition
- MultiPlayer Battle Arena (LOCAL,INTERNET,WI-FI,3G). Challenge other players to battle with your latest gear. (BETA at launch)
- In-game mail and item sharing system
- Over 300 animated and voiced cut-scenes to deliver the storyline
- Vast number of different weapons including pistols, rifles, swords, axes, shields, phasers, cannons,crossbows, explosive bolts, etc
- Vast number of skills and spells
- Online enemy database http://www.missioneuropagame.com/beast.php
- Online armor database http://www.missioneuropagame.com/armorData.php
- Online armory database http://missioneuropagame.com/itemsData.php
- Custom online achievement system. Includes character photos, gear and achievement information. View it here: http://missioneuropagame.com/
- Battle over 60 enemies on the screen at once
- Customize your controls it fit your own style
- Create your own items and equipment
- Choose your own character development path with experience points
- Build a unique hero with 16 separate equipment slots for armor and weapons
- Learn multitude of new combat skills from poison to explode
- Conquer unspeakable creatures and use Summons to make them battle for you

Exclusive Collector's Edition perks
- All 5 episodes included
- Game is open to immediately explore with the teleporter
- 2X the armor sets (You can wear enemy armor and flesh)
- Epic Sword
- Saintly Armor
- 100 Mana potions
- 100 Health potions
- Collectors Editon Icon

Source: The Game Website.

101808.name: BreakOut Mania
101808.description:
Source: The Developer Website.
BreakOut Mania gives a fun and exciting new twist on the old breakout style games.

User Summary:
Specifically, BreakOut Mania permits you to control the speed of the ball. The faster you go, the more points you score. Based on Atari's Breakout series.

101809.name: Coin Drop!
101809.description:
Press release:

Bad Pennies have invaded the colorful world of Coin Drop and only you can save the day. Drop, bounce and smash your way through 60 fun-filled levels across four fantastic worlds, as you rescue the Girl Coins from the Bad Pennies. Coin Drop will feature hours of challenging, wonderful physics based fun for everyone.

Coin Drop Features:

Drop, Spin, Smash, Bounce, Demolish and Shake, with Puzzles, Portals, Lasers, Magnets, Stars, Pins and... much, much, much more
60 fun-filled levels packed with imagination and variety
Universal App: play on iPhone, iPod touch or iPad
Awesome audio and catchy soundtrack
Game Center support
High Definition visuals for iPhone 4

101810.name: Skeeball 3D
101810.description:
User Summary

A 3D implementation of the arcade classic skeeball. There are two looks featured in this game: neon or regular. You can flip between the two at will.

101811.name: Transformers 3: Defend The Earth
101811.description:
TF3: Defend The Earth is the first ever app of its kind, bringing a special edition of the Transformers 3 movie poster to life. Users simply aim their device’s camera at the poster activating Optimus Prime to defend Earth in an Augmented Reality game against the Decepticons. Players are able to share their scores and achievements on their Facebook profiles while geolocation allows players to find the nearest participating location where they can unlock the experience.

Source: The Game Website.

101812.name: AlexPanda
101812.description:
Simple but addictive, drag AlexPanda to the destination while evading all the dangers. Supports Game Center.

Poor Alex the Panda is having his flight trip to Hawaii but accidentally drops out of the plane to a deserted tropical island. Alex is too lazy to escape, so you are the only one that can help him to survive through all kinds of dangers!

Alex just doesn’t realize how desperate he is on this island. Drag him back and forth to finish every stage to keep him safe while getting to the destination. Alex is innocent, maybe a bit naive, but you’d better remind him of all the dangers in this terrible world.

Get higher scores of the stage by getting more flowers. Every time you finish a stage, you’ll get your score and you can compare with the global best score. Help Alex as quickly as possible to beat the record!

Hidden flowers and creative techniques are everywhere in the game for you to explore. In a place full of uncertainties, considering how grave a helpless panda is. Try every method you can imagine to get Alex moving safely.

Source: The Game Website.

101813.name: e-Pig Dive Treasure Hunter
101813.description:
Hey adventurer!

Join the brave Eddie Pig in this thrilling new adventure in search of wonderful treasures in the mysterious waters of the South Pacific. Thousands of wealth stolen by the Privateer Sir Francis Drake and the treasures of Juan Esteban Echeverría Ubilla XVIII are submerged there!, but you must find them!. But be careful, you will fight a vengeful ghost Pirate, angry octopuses, hungry sea turtles, deranged and poisonous jellyfish, dangerous pufferfish and the impressive, legendary giant whale Mocha Dick, all in a race against time before your air runs out !. But not everything is so terrible, do not worry, you can get on a submarine and get extra energy to accomplish your task.

Only the brave will get all this gold!

Climb aboard and participate in this great and “ePig” adventure! Become a Pirate!

Features:

45 Achievements.
Shop to Upgrade stuff.
Unique Gameplay.
Stunning Graphics. (Retina Display for supported devices)
GameCenter (for supported devices)
Funny Sounds.
Great Music.
And your favorite character, Eddie!




Source: The Game Website.

101814.name: Snake Eyes
101814.description:
From publisher blurb:

An adventure for Agents of SWING that takes your intrepid secret agents from smoky rooms in London to the sapphire seas of the Caribbean and to the den of sin and iniquity that is Vegas. Hot on the trail of a villainous organisation known only as COIL.

101815.name: Empires: Dawn of the Modern World
videogamehonor: 2004 D.I.C.E. Strategy Game of the Year Nominee (Computer)
101815.description:
Empires: Dawn of the Modern World is a history-based real-time strategy computer game. Considered an unofficial sequel to Empire Earth, the game requires players to collect resources to build an empire, train military units, and conquer opposing civilizations.
Based on a slightly compressed version of world history, Empires covers five eras, from the Medieval Age to World War II. The game features nine civilizations: England, the Franks, Korea and China are playable from the Medieval Age to the Imperial Age; the United States, Russia, Germany, France and the United Kingdom are playable in the World War I and World War II ages.

Source: Wikipedia, "Empires: Dawn of the Modern World", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

videogame: Empire Earth II: The Art of Supremacy
101816.name: Empire Earth II (Gold Edition)
videogamecompilation: Empire Earth II: The Art of Supremacy
101816.description:
User Summary

Empire Earth II (Gold Edition) is a compilation of Empire Earth II and its expansion; Empire Earth II: The Art of Supremacy.

101817.name: Caesar (Die Gold-Edition)
101817.description:
User Summary

Caesar (Die Gold-Edition) is a compilation of Caesar and its sequel; Caesar II. Also included was a exclusive preview of the series' next game, Caesar III.

101818.name: Asterix and Obelix Take on Caesar
101818.description:
User Summary

Asterix and Obelix Take on Caesar is a game based on the film by Claude Zidi, adapted from the work and characters of René Goscinny and Albert Uderzo. Players take the role of either Asterix or Obelix fighting Roman soldiers and overcoming other dangers to rescue the Druid Getafix.

101819.name: Asterix & Obelix XXL 2: Mission – Las Vegum
101819.description:
Asterix & Obelix XXL 2 - Mission: Las Vegum is an Action-adventure game for PC and the PlayStation 2, the sequel of Asterix & Obelix XXL. It was released in 2005 exclusively in Europe, due to the lower popularity of the franchise in the United States and Japan. The game stars the French comic book characters, Asterix and Obelix, and features spoofs to many classic games, in the same fashion that the comics spoof historical characters and make many cultural references. One such example of this is the box art that has a passing resemblance to the one seen in Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas.
Julius Caesar, in another plan to conquer Gaul, builds a theme park called Las Vegum, a parody of Las Vegas. Getafix then swears loyalty to Caesar, and goes to Las Vegum. Asterix and Obelix comes to his rescue, with the help of a Roman spy named Sam Shieffer, a reference to Sam Fisher from the Splinter Cell series.
Las Vegum is divided in 6 zones: Lutetia, WCW, LuckSore (Luxour), Little Venetia, Pirate Island, and SeizeUs Palace. Throughout the game, Romans who slightly resemble famous video game heroes (Mario, Sonic the Hedgehog, Rayman, Pacman, Ryu and Lara Croft) appear as frequent enemies

Source: Wikipedia, "Asterix & Obelix XXL 2: Mission Las Vegum", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101820.name: Asterix & Obelix XXL 2: Mission – Wifix
101820.description:
Asterix & Obelix XXL 2: Mission Wifix is an Action-adventure game for the PlayStation Portable and the Nintendo DS, sequel of Asterix & Obelix XXL. It is a remake of Asterix & Obelix XXL 2: Mission Las Vegum. It revolves around the same plot, with added touch screen minigames, and Wi-Fi.
The game is a sidescroller through a 3D world. It uses almost all of the same elements as the console version. The player can switch between Asterix and Obelix at any time. Almost every room from the console version is recreated with its hundreds of parodies of many video game series. Occasionally the player must complete touch-screen mini-games throughout the story which can also be played outside of the main adventure mode.
The game takes the player through such places like Little Paris, WCW, LuckSore, Little Venetia, Pirate Island, and even SeizeUs Palace with each room being created in great detail. The game was considered fun and interesting by users receiving a score of 87 from 47 user ratings on Gamespot.com
The main drawback noted by users was that the game could become repetitive after some time.

Source: Wikipedia, "Asterix & Obelix XXL 2: Mission: Wifix", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101821.name: Asterix: Search for Dogmatix
101821.description:
User Summary

Players play as either Asterix or Obelix in an adventure that takes them from Gaul to Rome in an attempt to find Obelix's dog; Dogmatix. The game allows players to choose what order they will visit various stages of the adventure and includes a number of many games in addition to the main adventure.

101822.name: Asterix and the Magic Carpet
101822.description:
User Summary

This game is based on one of the famous comic books featuring Asterix and Obelix : Asterix and the Magic Carpet. The player watches static cartoon scenes and makes choices/provides answers in order to proceed on their travels.

101823.name: Asterix Mega Madness
101823.description:
User Summary

Asterix Mega Madness involves a series of wild competitions revolving around the characters and setting of the popular Asterix comic books. The sporting events in the game include an eating competition and a catapult race.

101824.name: Astérix & Obelix
101824.description:
User Summary

Astérix & Obelix is a platform game featuring the popular comic characters; Astérix & Obelix. Players can play as one of Astérix or Obelix or two players can play simultaneously. The mission of the Gauls is to collect is to acquire various ancient artefacts on their travels across Europe.

101825.name: Descent Venture Pack
101825.description:
User Summary

The Descent Venture Pack is a compilation of the three Descent games: Descent, Descent II and Descent³ and expansions for the latter two games: Descent II: The Infinite Abyss and Descent³: Mercenary.

101826.name: Descent I and II: The Definitive Collection
101826.description:
User Summary

Descent I and II: The Definitive Collection is a compilation including the games Descent and Descent II and add-ons for both: Descent: Levels of the World and Descent: Levels of the World. Also included was official Descent custom map-making software.

101827.name: Yes, Prime Minister
101827.description:
User Summary

Yes,Prime Minister puts the player in the role of British Prime Minister James (Jim) Hacker from the classic BBC television comedy "Yes, Prime Minister".
As Prime Minister the player must balance their popularity with the public and their party's needs all the while having numerous political problems to solve much of which is drawn from the television show.

101828.name: The Cardinal of the Kremlin
101828.description:
User Summary

The Cardinal of the Kremlin is a management simulation based on the novel of the same name by Tom Clancy. The game puts the player into the position of a US Project leader charged with deploying a laser defence grid before the Russians. It is up to the player to use the available espionage resources to determine whether those they are dealing with are trustworthy or not.

101829.name: Raveleijn
101829.description:
Free translation of the back of the box

At the gate of Raveleijn the adventure begins for Joost, Thomas, Emma, Lisa and Maurits. Here starts a dangerous excursion through the woods, on the way to free the city Raveleijn. As knights you fight together against malicious Graffers. Use your special strength to become as strong as possible for the ultimate fight.
In the final battle the powerful count Graveheart awaits you. Only the bravest knights survive this last fight.
Who becomes the hero of Raveleijn?

This family game was made to promote the new attraction 'Raveleijn' in the Efteling amusement park.

Goal of the game: Free Ravelijn city of the mean count Graveheart and his Graffers

Each player chooses a color and the accompanying character. Each character has a special characteristic that he can use in the fights against the Graffers.
