On one side of the board you will fight against the Graffers by rolling the dice. Other players can come to help you. For each "hit" you get a card. After the defeat of all the Graffers (5), the board will be turned and you will prepare for the final fight against count Graveheart.
The player who has the smallest value with the obtained cards gives up his character and will play count Graveheart.
The obtained cards from the previous round will give you life points for this fight. The better you fought the Graffers, the stronger you are to fight count Graveheart!!
Each time you can beat the count in a fight, you will get a coin. As soon as the count looses all his life points, the player that has the majority of the coins wins the game.
Count Graveheart wins the game if he can defeat all other players.

101830.name: The New Titans Sourcebook
101830.description:
User Description

The New Titans Sourcebook covers everything (up to the date of publication) about the Titans including the post-Crisise history and the stats of the Heroes and their Foes.

101831.name: The Atlas of the DC Universe
101831.description:
User Description

The Atlas contants the backgroud and maps of the DC multiverse and characters stats for the DC Heroes role-playing game. Also full colour gatefold maps of the United States and the Earth, giving detailed locations of cites and contries.

101832.name: Deadly Fusion
101832.description:
From the back cover

Deadly Fusion is the first Match-Play adventure for use with the second edition of the DC HEROES Role-Playing Game and may be used with the first edition. It can be played by two or three players.

101833.name: The Law of Darkness
101833.description:
User Description

A New Gods adventure which the players (The New Gods) will fight Darkseid and will try to prevent him realizing his twisted dreams.

101834.name: Trial & Balance
101834.description:
"The Off-Balance Game For Levelheaded People"

This is a vintage dexterity game from 1969. Based on the business executives shown on the cover illustration Trial & Balance was the kind of decorative item a corporate ladder-climber would keep on his desk.

The challenge is based on a fulcrum and balance beam with six slots spaced at regular intervals. There are six small weighted tokens that are maneuvered in these slots during play as the beam wobbles like a teeter-totter.

101836.name: Triple Flip
101836.description:
The object of Triple Flip game is for a player to have the least number of disks in his or her goal after all disks are in the goals. This battery-operated game has air blown through holes in the game board which allows disks to move on a cushion of air.

Contents:

1 Battery-Operated game unit (with 3 sets of flippers)
1 Plastic stopper bar
3 Plastic goals
12 Game disks

101837.name: Richochet 4
101837.description:
Players try to slide the puck off the bumpers into the right holes. Object is to be the first to get 4 in a row to win the game.

Contents:

2 part electronic game base
2 sliders
16 yellow discs
16 red discs
6 super rubberbands
8 pegs & 4 legs

101838.name: War in Middle Earth
101838.description:
War in Middle Earth is a real-time strategy game. The game combined both large scale army unit level and small scale character level. All the action happened simultaneously in game world and places could be seen from the map or at the ground level. Individual characters could also be seen in larger battles (in which they either survived or died — Gandalf alone could easily defeat a hundred orcs). If the battle is quite small (less than 100 units approximately) it can be watched on ground level. Otherwise it will be only displayed numerically. On ground level characters could acquire objects and talk with computer controlled friendly characters (such as Radagast or Tom Bombadil).

Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/War_in_Middle_Earth_%281988_vid...; available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101840.description:
User Summary

North Star Games made this personality card with 7 of Scott Alden´s favorite questions.
101840.name: Wits & Wagers: Scott Alden Personality Card Promo
boardgameexpansion: Wits & Wagers

101841.description:
User Summary

North Star Games made this personality card with 7 of Richard Borg´s favorite questions.
101841.name: Wits & Wagers: Richard Borg Personality Card Promo
boardgameexpansion: Wits & Wagers

101842.description:
User Summary

North Star Games made this personality card with 7 of Alan R. Moon´s favorite questions.
101842.name: Wits & Wagers: Alan R. Moon Personality Card Promo
boardgameexpansion: Wits & Wagers

101843.name: Quintett
101843.description:
Released in Spielerei No. 3

A game based on an idea from the movie "Quintett" from Robert Altmann.

Each player receives 3 playing pieces in one color. Additionally 3 dice are required.

A game is played in three rounds, each round consists of two phases: At the start of a round, a game chief is determined by rolling dice. This chief places one playing piece of each player on the hunting circle, to determine the hunting order: The order shows, which color can be attacked or must defend itself from the other colors.

Afterwards the players place their remaining playing pieces on the game board. Depending on the dice numbers they move their pieces and try to attack the appropriate colors. Certain dice combinations are keeping the own playing pieces safe. The game chief can redistribute the hunting order during the round. The winner of this phase plays against the game chief in a second phase. The player with remaining playing pieces on the game board wins the round.

101845.name: Überläufer
101845.description:
Released in the magazine Spielerei No. 4.

Besides the game board you need three different playing pieces, four dice and paper and pen.

At the start of the game every player chooses one of the embassies at the edge of the game board and secretly chooses one of the playing pieces as a double agent.

The playing pieces start in the center of the game board and the players try to move them into their chosen embassies. All players roll their dice. Starting with the player getting highest result, the players moves one of the playing pieces. The players an voluntarily use less movement points or can cooperate with other players to move their agents as wished.

At the end of the game the players score points for agents in their embassies and for their double agents. The player with most points wins a game of "Überläufer".

101846.name: Sheeps
101846.description:
Released in the magazine Spielerei No. 5.

Each player receives 6 playing pieces of the same color, representing the sheeps and a differently colored playing piece, representing a dog.

With help of their dogs the players try to chase the sheeps into their enclosure. The sheeps start the game on their starting spaces. The dogs are in their kennels.

A player's turn consists of two actions: Firstly, he moves his dog one space in any of the eight directions. Secondly, he moves all sheep standing on one of the orthogonal or diagonal lines away from his dog.

The first player with all his sheep in his enclosure wins the game.

101847.name: Kundschafter im All
101847.description:
Released in the magazine Spielerei No. 6.

Besides the game board the players need a pencil and 4x 6 basic playing cards with values ace, 2, 3, 4 ,5, 6.

The goal of the game is to visit all 8 planets starting on earth and to come back again.

At the start of the game the positions of the planets are randomly determined. Afterwards every player gets 3 cards to move his space ship. The numbers both determine the distance and possible changes of the direction. The planets need to be visited in numbered order.

First player back on earth wins the game.

Its German version Space Explorer from book Beyond Competition

101848.name: Pro Evolution Soccer 2011
videogamehonor: 2011 British Academy Game Awards Best Sports Game of the Year Nominee
101848.description:
"Pro Evolution Soccer 2011 (officially abbreviated as PES 2011 and known as World Soccer: Winning Eleven 2011 in Asia) is an association football video game in the Pro Evolution Soccer series developed and published by Konami with production assistance from the Blue Sky Team. The game was announced on 9 February 2010 and was released on the PlayStation 3, PC and Xbox 360 on 30 September 2010 in the European Union and 8 October 2010 in the United Kingdom. The versions of Wii, PlayStation 2, and PlayStation Portable were released on 28 October 2010. The UEFA Champions League and UEFA Europa League are featured within the game, and for the first time in the series, UEFA Super Cup and CONMEBOL's Copa Libertadores will be fully licensed. The first trailer was released on 4 May 2010, while an E3 trailer was released in June 2010, showing some of the new features of the game. The game also sees the return of Lionel Messi as its cover star.

ITV's Jim Beglin has been implemented as new co-commentator to Jon Champion for PES 2011. A demo of PES 2011 was released for PC and PS3 on 15 September 2010. The demo allowed users to play ten minute games with four teams available: FC Barcelona and Bayern Munich or Copa Libertadores pair Chivas de Guadalajara and SC Internacional. A video presentation was also included after each match outlining the full game's content in readiness of the game's UK launch on 8 October 2010.

Source: Wikipedia, "Pro Evolution Soccer 2011", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101849.name: ARAM
101849.description:
Released in magazine Spielerei No. 8.

Both players receive 12 playing pieces and places them on his base line.

Players take turns and move a single piece when it is their turn. The playing spaces both determine the distance and the direction of the moving pieces. White - one space, yellow - two spaces, red - three spaces. Spaces with own playing pieces are ignored during the move, opposite playing pieces are removed.

Last player with playing pieces wins the game.

101850.name: Punktejagd
101850.description:
Place 5 at the "Hippodice Spieleautorenwettbewerb 1989".

Released in the magazine Spielerei No. 15.

You try to geet the most victory points at game end.

The playing board shows a game track, a points track and a bonus track. Players start with 3 playing pieces on the game track. By rolling a die they move the pieces on the game board. On certain spaces the playing pieces can move from the game track to the points track and further on to the bonus track. Players can remove opposing playing pieces.

Game ends as soon as the first player has no playing pieces left on the outer track. All players count the points on the spaces of their playing pieces. Highest score wins the game.

101851.name: Penetrator
videogamehonor: 1983 Golden Joystick Best Arcade-Style Game of the Year Nominee
101851.description:
Penetrator is an early Sinclair ZX Spectrum game made by Melbourne House programmer Philip Mitchell, one of the early hits. It was released in 1982 as a clone of the Scramble arcade game.

In Penetrator, the gamer flies a ship, which can shoot forwards and drop bombs beneath the ship. The first level is on open air, with just mountains to dodge, missiles which try to hit the ship, and animated radars. From the second level onwards, the game is inside increasingly complex caverns, so the ceiling is also a danger, as well as new enemies - the missiles are now sometimes replaced with skulls that can move up and down, blocking the path.

The levels change with no pause, only the screen colour changes. After four levels there is a short fifth level where a base needs to be destroyed by dropping a bomb precisely, and then there is a firework animation as a reward. After all levels are finished, the ship goes back through inversed levels, with backward turned landscape.

Source: Wikipedia, "Penetrator (computer game)" available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101852.name: TWERPS: Rocket Rangers
101852.description:
from the back of the book:

Yes, its ROCKET RANGERS, the long-awaited companion volume to TWERPS SPACE CADETS ! With ROCKET RANGERS, your charakter can design, build and fly your own spaceships. New charakter classes include Pilots, Navigators, Gunners, and Engineers ! Complete spaceship combat rules, which integrate man-to-man and ship-to-ship action, are also included. So suit up ! Seal the hatch ! Fire up the engines ! Break out the champagne ! With ROCKET RANGERS, the stars are the limit !
This is an expansion set for the TWERPS Game System. TWERPS Basic Rules (GS 10455) and SPACE CADETS are also required.

101853.name: Hexteroyd
boardgameversion: "Tutto è numero" Abstract Strategy Game Design Contest version
101853.description:
Hexteroyd is an abstract strategy game for 2 players with a background theme of Asteroid Mining. It plays in approximately 20 minutes.
Players take turn placing and removing pawns (the Colonies) on an hexagonal board (the Asteroid belt) with 5 hexagonal cells (the Asteroids) per side.
Playing the Colonies allow to have the controls of the cells through double-sided discs (the Mines).
Aim of the game is having control of the most valuable group of Mines (a Chain): the value of a Chain is given by the sum of the values of the adjacent Colonies.

The game will participate in an Abstract Strategy Game Design Contest in the mathematics festival "Tutto è Numero" in Caldè (Italy) at the end of July 2011

What's so special about Hexteroyd ?

Hexteroyd is a kind of connection game but with several twists:
- First and foremost, you don't need to connect distant parts of the board. You must connect points to... gain points !
- The pawns you use are shared between the players and have a double role: they allow the players to make actions and they are the points themselves: positive if you connect them on the board, negative if you keep them in your hand.
- You don't directly place the connecting pieces on the board: they come into play as a consequence of your playing a pawn, whether you place it on, or remove it from, the board.
- Connecting pieces (the discs) aren't fix, they have a certain degree of variability as the result of players' actions: once they are on the board, they remain on their cell, but they change owner, therefore changing the connected pawns.
Thanks to these characteristics, some parts of the board (usually the peripheral ones) are constantly subject to subtle but meaningful changes and the victory is somewhat uncertain till the end.

The strategic aspect of Hexteroyd originates in the different ways in which you can use pawns: if you tend to empty your hand, you will have more territory control but less mobility; if you keep them in hand you risk to lose points in the end if you can't get rid of them.

101854.name: Velvet Lounge
101854.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Scenariusz do gry fabularnej ROBOTICA, opowiadający o paranoicznej Hiperistocie, tajnej placówce korporacji i jej sekretach oraz losach kilku naiwnych postaci, które wplątują się w spore kłopoty. VELVET LOUNGE do pobrania stąd: plik PDF około 2MB wielkości. Dodatkowym elementem jest mapa, która dostępna jest w wysokiej rozdzielczości.

and translation:

Scenario for role playing game ROBOTICA, which tells the story about paranoical hyperbeing, secret outpost of corporations and it's secrets; and a fate of few naive characters, which are involved in some serious troubles. VELVET LOUNGE is for download: PDF file, around 2 MB. Additionally there is a map available in high resolution.

101855.name: TWERPS TWEK
101855.description:
from the back of the book:

"Space... is pretty darn BIG!"
Transport your game crew into space, where they'll explore the endless frontiers of a mirthful mythos...

TWERPS Basic Rules, Space Cadets and Rocket Rangers required

101857.name: Desperados: Wanted Dead or Alive
101857.description:
User Summary

Desperados: Wanted Dead or Alive is a stealth-based, top-down/isometric real-time tactics computer game, in which the player controls up to six characters in a Wild-West setting.
The protagonist, John Cooper, is a wordly knife fighter and gunslinger, who takes on a bounty to capture the notorious train robber named "El Diablo".
As Cooper sets off on his quest, he is aided by five other friends along the way, all with different special abilities, and they work together, through the exciting chapters, in the attempt to locate and arrest the mysterious "El Diablo".
Desparados is a very well composed, and interesting strategy game, where timing is the keyword, and the beautiful well-drawn Wild-West scenery, spiced with an excellent soundtrack, creates together a fantastic immersive atmosphere.

101858.name: Desperados 2: Cooper's Revenge
101858.description:
User Summary

"Desperados 2: Cooper's Revenge" is the sequel to the 2001 computer game "Desperados: Wanted Dead or Alive".
John Cooper's brother, Marshal Ross Cooper, has been killed by a criminal called "Angel Face", and John wants to avenge him. Along with his new ally Hawkeye, he gathers his friends once again, and together they start looking for any clue that would lead them to Ross' killer. Soon they find out that John's brother was killed because he was investigating evil plans between soldiers and the red Indians...
Once again you control John Cooper and his gang. Though it's possible to play the game in an top-down/isometric view much like the previous game, Desperados 2 is rendered fully in realtime 3D, allowing the player to zoom and rotate the camera in many angels. The camera can even be switched to a third person view, and follow the individual characters around. This increased functionality becomes especially useful when moving around inside a building or engaging enemies in gunplay.

101859.description:
The game consists of two phases, a placement phase followed by a movement phase. The two players White and Black each have twelve pieces.

PLACEMENT PHASE:
Beginning with White, the players alternate placing one of their twelve pieces on one of the 37 crossing points on the board.
Once all pieces have been placed, the movement phase begins. A piece can be captured during this phase (see below).

MOVEMENT PHASE:
The players alternate moving one of their pieces to an adjacent and empty crossing point. A piece can be captured during this phase (see below). If a player has only 4 remaining pieces, they are allowed to move their piece to any empty crossing point.

QUADRATES:
A quadrate occurs when a piece is placed such that the 4 corners of a square are occupied by that player's pieces. Quadrates come in 6 different sizes. To form a quadrate, a player must have their pieces on all 4 corners of a square composed of either 2,4,8,16,18, or 32 triangles.

The table below indicates the number of possible quadrates composed of a given number of triangles:

No. of Triangles/No. of Quadrates
2 - 24
4 - 12
8 - 13
16 - 5
18 - 4
32 - 1

For any of the larger quadrates (8,16,18,32), the quadrate is invalid if there is an opposing piece on any position along the side.Only friendly or empty positions are allowed along the edges (sides) of a quadrate.

CAPTURE:
If after placing a piece, a quadrate is formed, the player can remove an opponent piece which does not itself form a quadrate with 3 other pieces.

Once a player has only 3 remaining pieces, they lose the game. If the same position occurs 3 times, then the game is declared a draw.

Notes:
o In rare cases, all of a player's pieces may be trapped thus requiring the player to pass.
o Danish Quarto has some similiarities to the Morris family of European board games, but also shares important features of a Chinese game named `Fang`
101859.name: Quarto

101861.name: Mystery Date Electronic Board Game
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 10 Akrotiri & 7 Wonders Duel
101861.description:
From the back of the box:
Are you ready for your mystery date?
The game with the electronic talking phone
The game changes every time you play!
So use the clues you hear and see if you can solve each mystery

Mystery Date: The Game With The Electronic Talking Phone

This is the 1999 version of Mystery Date but is vastly different than the others. This is more like Electronic Dream Phone!

The classic mystery game for girls is updated for the new millennium. With 3 kinds of fun mysteries to solve - Dating Line - Mystery Line - Party Planning Line.

Dating Line: Be the first player to find out which boy wants to ask you out on a date. (There is only one secret Mystery Boy chosen per game - the same for all players. It changes for each new game you begin)

Mystery Line: Be the first player to find out who the Mystery Boy is depending on one of threee randomly selected themes:

What boy was voted class president and how many votes did he get? or
What boy won the science contest and how much money did he win? or
What boy is the captain of the soccer team and how many goals did he score?




Party Line: Be the first player to get six boys to come to your party.

Game play is generally calling one of the boys (from the cards in your hand) and listening to the clue he gives, look at the pictures in the frames, and then record the information on your clue sheet.

101862.name: Global Challenge: The game of international peacekeeping-operations
101862.description: Game produced by Identity Games Int. at the request of the dutch army. Its for 2-4 players and take 1-2 hours. The gameboard shows different countries where peacekeeping-operations can be done. Each peacekeeping-operation has 3 different sub-missions (Humanitary-aid, Peace-keeping, Peace-enforcing). When landing on a country the player takes a Oppertunity & Threats card which shows what mission needs to be prefomed and what is needed to complete it. The player also takes a Strategy card that can be used for special effects. Completing missions and being in charge of a region (on of the board edges) gives victory points. depending on the number of players 5, 7 or 11 victory points are required to win.

101864.description:
This Pack is only in German and English and contains 13 cards:

Harruli (Hero)
The level 1 and 2 adds 1/2 attack +1/2 per revealed spell. Level 3 adds 4 attack and allows you to draw three cards and add one spell cards to your hand.

The English version of this promo was included as part of the first Promo Pack.
101864.name: Thunderstone: German Promo Pack Harrulier (Harruli)
boardgameexpansion: Thunderstone

boardgamehonor: 2011 Best Historical Miniatures Rules or Expansion Nominee
101865.description:
Gripping Beast's Dark Ages miniatures skirmish. Each side has between 25 to 73 miniatures, organised into groups of 4-12 figures. Miniatures are classed as Hearthguard, Warriors, or Levy, and an army comprises of 4 or 6 points of units (1 point = 4 Hearthguard, 8 Warriors, or 12 Levy figures).

Each faction - Anglo-Danish, Viking, Welsh, Norman - has its own battleboard of command options, which are selected depending on the roll of your Saga Dice. Saga Dice have special icons and give your command choices for the turn.

Combat and shooting are simple and based on six-sided dice rolls, the real challenge is to use the options from your battleboard as effectively as possible. The core game comes with a battleboard for the four main factions, with future battleboard releases intended to cover other armies/factions.
101865.name: Saga
boardgameexpansion: Saga: Aetius & Arthur
Saga: Age of the Wolf
Saga: Northern Fury
Saga: The Raven's Shadow
Saga: Varjazi & Basileus
boardgamepodcastepisode: Meeples & Miniatures - Episode 85 - Saga & Northern Fury
Meeples & Miniatures - Episode 87 - More about Saga, Northern Fury and Skraelings
View from the Veranda - Salute 2011 Special

101866.name: War Against the Han
101866.description:
Printed on the back of the box-set:

This adventure source pack is intended to create an ongoing campaign for the High Adventure Cliffhanger: The Buck Rogers Adventure Game rules.

The War for Freedom Continues! Deep within the Grand Canyon lies a secret Han airbase. Hidden here is an irresistible super-weapon that will bring the rebellion to its knees. The only defense is for a small band of heroes to infiltrate the base and foil the plot before final disaster strikes! Armed with the best available weapons, and allied with both native American freedom fighters and the mysterious Golden Dragon Society, the heroes must attempt to stop the unstoppable.

This boxed campaign set expansion includes the following:

A 32 page full-color World at War book, which expands the world giving loads of information on new technologies, new places, and the people of the 25th Century.
A 48 page, full-color Campaigns vs. the Han book, which shows GM's how to construct campaigns, giving expanded tables for quick creation of adventures and gaming sessions. It also has a great adventure that pits the player characters against the Mongol Overlords.
2 full-color, poster-size maps put the 25th Century on your gaming table, including a large-scale playing map of a Han airship.
Lots of stand-up counters and terrain tiles.

101867.name: Combat Mission: Battle for Normandy
videogameexpansion: Combat Mission: Battle for Normandy – Commonwealth Forces
videogamehonor: 2011 Charles S. Roberts Best 20th Century Era - Modern Computer Wargame Nominee
2011 Charles S. Roberts Best 20th Century Era - Modern Computer Wargame Winner
101867.description:
From the Developer's Website:

Combat Mission Battle for Normandy uses our extremely powerful proprietary CMx2 game engine, the much improved and expanded second generation of Combat Mission products. This next generation engine is revolutionary as well as evolutionary, combining the best features of the previous CMx1 system with more detailed simulation elements, graphical depiction, user interface, and core game features. First used in the Combat Mission: Shock Force games, the game engine has been refined and evolved even further with 4 years of additional development, tweaking and improvements based on customer feedback.

Below is a short sampling of the vast number of features that await you in Combat Mission Battle for Normandy!

GAMEPLAY


Both RealTime (pausable) or WeGo (turn based, simultaneous turn execution) game modes
2-player Game Modes with Realtime over TCP/IP (LAN, Internet), WeGo with PBEM (Play by Email) or Hotseat
Story driven semi-dynamic campaigns, stand alone (non-campaign) battles, QuickBattle generator, and full featured Editor guarantee endless replayability
Allied vs. Axis, Allied vs. Allied and Axis vs. Axis play options


EDITOR

Full featured Game and Map Editor to create your own battles and maps - even campaigns - or edit existing battles and maps

New hierarchical interface to visually select specific vehicles, equipment, and other options for your scenarios
Unique and diverse mission objectives for each side, including several objective types (e.g. exit zones, unit and terrain based objectives) that can be hidden or known
Improved Scenario briefing format, including a new Designer Notes subsection
"Reduced headcount" option to simulate previously depleted formations

101869.name: CrazyControl
101869.description:
You will be able to use your left and right brain at the same time and it will enhance your ability for multitasking.

If you clear the final stage, you can brush your teeth and style your hair at the same time! Go ahead and test your multi-tasking your ability!

Features
- Think outside a box of controlling one game character with a controller.
You have to control maximum of 4 game characters with different patterned controls all at the same time.
- Think outside a box that the games are only limited to a stage.

You can enjoy extra games on the screen outside the stage such as intro, menu, settings, stage select and practice. This is a kind of bonus that adds to your high scores for higher game rankings.

How to play
- Crazy Control is a game of multi-control. You need to control multiple characters of different colors using the blue and red controllers at the same time. The red controller eats the red attack character and theblue eats the blue.
- rom the Stage 5, a new orange character is introduced and you need to touch the orange attack character on the screen with your finger to eat it.
- On the Stage 17, a new green character comes out and you will use the accelerometer on your iphone to control the character and eat the green attack character.
- As the stage goes up, the speed gets faster, more attack characters appear, and the moving patterns of the attack characters diversify.
- The help items that help the character will be a lot of help for your controls. whereas, the poison items will obstruct your controls. So be careful!
- On the intro, menu, settings, stage select and practice screen, the mini attack characters appears one after another. Control the mini green characters with an accelerometer and eat the mini attack characters. It will increase your high score by one point.

Source: The Game Website.

101870.name: CrazyControl 2
101870.description:
CrazyControl 2 is unlike any of the existing side scrolling games that you’ve seen, or played, before.

Imagine an energetic, challenging and exciting game with multiple characters under your control.

CrazyControl 2 starts with two characters running side-by-side, with the number of characters multiplying until a maximum of six characters must be controlled by a player at once.

This game is challenging and as such demands the full attention of new players. But after a player perfects their skills and clears the final stage, they can easily chat on messenger and talk on the phone, at the same time.

Scenario

The forest of eternity that protects the village is threatend by an unidentified evil spirit.

Many of the trees in the forest are barren, and strange things begin to happen in the forest. The villagers are being threatened by unknown monsters.

To solve the mystery, the village chief orders his guards to find the source of evil.

The guards get closer and closer to uncovering the source of the evil, but when they have almost succeeded, a monumental betrayal transpires.

Source: The Game Website.

101871.name: Monster in My Pocket Battle Cards
101871.description:
Monster in My Pocket Battle Cards is a simple game played by two or more. The game features a deck of 48 cards, each displaying a Monster in My Pocket monster (eg. 'Werewolf', 'Hobgoblin', 'Manticore') along with five statistics: intelligence, strength, speed, weakness and point value (a total of the other categories), plus two Wild Cards.

After the deck is dealt out, each player turns over their top card. A die is rolled to determine which category is being assessed (rolling a 6 is 'you pick') and players compare cards. The player with the highest value in the chosen category wins the cards in play and puts them at the bottom of their pile. Ties are resolved by playing another round, with the eventual winner collecting all of the acumulated cards. Wild Cards win a round automatically.

After each round the die is passed along and rounds are played until one player has won all of the other cards.

The game came packaged with two Monster in My Pocket collectible figures ('The Beast' and 'Witch').

101872.name: Win, Don't Lose
101872.description:
The object is to win, and not to lose. Win, Don’t Lose is a fast, fun and hilarious card game with only a handful of rules. While there are routes to victory described in the rules, many of the cards supply their own way to win, such as setting your opponents on fire, or managing to stick around long enough to get your tax return. The game has multiple "modules", which can be added over time, so that a new player can play the basic game after only a minute of explanation. Each module adds another rule to the game, and the game builds on itself.

Win, Don't Lose is a public domain game, so anyone is free to make their own copy of the game.

101873.name: Paradroid 90
101873.description:
Box cover

The droid crew of a galactic space freighter have turned against their master. Using the "Influence Device", beam aboard and destroy the mutinous crew.

User Summary

Paradroid 90 is a top-down perspective game where you move about various decks of a spaceship encountering hostile droids. The ship decks themselves essentially consist of rooms, doors, elevators and repair stations. The repair stations repair your active droid and the elevators let you move between floors.

The overall goal of the game is to eliminate all droids on all of the levels of the ship. This is done either by shooting them up using your own droid's weaponry or taking control over them directly via a mini-game, eventually gaining control over the more powerful droids and their arsenal. After completing one ship you go on to a new one with a different deck layout.

The various droids have different speed, resilience and weapon strength, but the stronger droids also typically have higher circuit integrity making it more difficult to control them for long, thus balancing the use for high lever droids on low level decks.

101874.name: Capt'n Sharky: Messer werfen
101874.description:
From the back of the box:

The blades will get stuck in the planks of the deck, but the pirates need great skill to throw their knives in an empty space. If you hit a space that is already occupied, it is the next players turn. Who is the first one to get all his knives stuck in the wooden deck?

A safe game with a magnetic knife that demands instinctive feeling.

101875.name: Europa Universalis III: Heir to the Throne
101875.description:
Requested by the fans, Heir to the Throne is the third expansion to the preeminent historical strategy game Europa Universalis III. The expansion takes the hugely successful game beyond complete, with improvements across the board:
Features


Intriguing Casus Belli system, where wars have specific goals from start to finish.
Monarchs now belong to dynasties, with far reaching effects on the diplomatic model.
More involving and powerful Holy Roman Empire and Papacy options.
Special diplomatic options for Republics.
Set your National Focus in a province to enhance growth and strengthen your hold in the region.
Permanent Terra Incognita removed and replaced with impassable regions
Cultural Tradition allows better advisors in the same way that Military Tradition allows better generals and admirals.
Many other additions and improvements.


Source: The Publisher Website.

101876.name: Aura: Fate of the Ages
101876.description:
From the back of the box:

Great power and immortality await those who possess the sacred rings.

Legends say that through the ages elders have passed down the secret of creating parallel worlds and alternate realities to a chosen few. This secret lies in the power of magiical rings which when combined with sacres artifacts will grant the bearer unlimited power and immortality.

Take on the quest to guard the magical rings and discover the artifacts concealed in the unique and visually stunning worlds. In this timeless tale of good versus evil, begin a journey of exploration into magical lands filled with astonishing magic, mechanical wonders, and hidden realities.

The Fate of the Ages is in your hands...

101877.name: Barbarian (CPC/ST)
101877.description:
Barbarian is a 1987 computer platform game by Psygnosis. It was first developed for the Atari ST, but eventually ported to other popular platforms of the home computer era.

In the game, the player is Hegor, a barbarian who must traverse several dungeons and underground habitats to defeat his brother, the evil sorcerer Necron. He has a sword and bow in his arsenal of weapons. Running and jumping, as with many platform games, comprises a large part of the gameplay of this title.

The game used a unique control system to make up for lack of more than one joystick button on many systems. The player would first press the one button after which a "menu" of actions would appear along the bottom of the screen. The player then selected the desired action by cycling through the choices with the joystick and then pressing the button again when the desired action was highlighted.

In the original versions, this game tried to emulate the visual style of the game cover and opening animation. The game used very detailed and colorful sprites and a variety of thoughtful sound effects to accompany the onscreen action. The DOS version played digitized speech in the opening sequence and featured other sound effects using the PC speaker.

Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barbarian_%28Psygnosis%29"; available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101878.name: Ork
101878.description:
Ork is a platform game with five levels. It takes place on an alien planet called Cisskei, where the player character, an alien called Ku-Kabul, must find his way through each level in turn. The levels are filled with puzzles to solve and enemies to kill. Ku-Kabul is equipped with a machine gun and a jetpack. However, these must be used with care, because ammunition and fuel come in a finite supply, although replenishments can be found in some places.

Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ork_%28video_game%29"; available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101879.description:
From publisher blurb:

See who can act out the most fancy words in this game that will make you giggle! Packaged in our colorful carry-along bag that's made for the fun-lover on the move...Games to Go!

Contents: 48 action cards, 10 card stands, 21 game chips, colorful carry-along bag

User summary:

On each turn the current player will draw an action card, and then perform in sequence from memory the actions of any previously drawn action cards as well as the card just drawn.

Players get a number of chips to trade in for hints should they not be able to remember a portion of the sequence; the player who can perform the longest sequence correctly without running out of chips is the winner.

The action cards have both the name of the action as well as a picture demonstrating the action for children too young to read.
101879.name: Fancy Nancy Acting Fancy

101882.name: Angry Wizards
101882.description:
User Summary

This XBLA Indie title features grumpy wizards attempting to find their way through a maze. The view is top-down and the mechanic is a twin-stick shooter. Players may play co-op with up to four people.

101883.name: TIC: Part 1
101883.description:
User Summary

TIC is a unicycling robot with a drill and a helicopter head. TIC is friendly and must collect acorns to power up. The world is lush and bright, with cheery graphics and humorous characters. TIC must avoid driller robots and pits and traps.

101884.name: Solar
101884.description:
User Summary

Solar is a gentle game where you control a planet. You start as a dead planet and then gain moons by flying near to asteroids. You may then absorb them into the mass of the planet to grow. Eventually your planet will sustain life, and when you grow larger, you can attack other planets.

101885.name: Solar 2
101885.description:
User Summary

Solar 2 is very similar to the original Solar, with some upgrades and tweaks to improve gameplay. This sequel adds missions, larger ships, a heads-up display and a humorous tutorial segment. Ships, planets and asteroids level up to grow stronger. Systems are more intricate and clear data is compiled about your planet as you fly.

101886.name: Techno Kitten Adventure
101886.description:
User Summary

Techno Kitten Adventure is an endurance game where you play a kitten on a jetpack and avoid oncoming obstacles while listening to house music. Also there's rainbows.

101887.name: A Game About My Cat
101887.description:
User Summary

Sled down a hill in a litterbox and perform tricks to unlock pictures of the developer's cat. Also includes a laser-pointer toy that is just a cartoon cat that can be moved around the screen.

101888.name: Who is the Best: Math
101888.description:
User Summary

Solve basic math problems and compete with your friends.

101889.name: The Impossible Game
101889.description:
"Having become one of the best-selling games on the Xbox Live Indie Game store, The Impossible Game is now available on iPhone, iPod Touch and iPad!

The Impossible Game is a minimalist platformer with only one button, and has been described as "platforming taken back to its roots" by GameTrailers.com. Jumping over a series of spikes, pits and blocks may sound easy, but The Impossible Game, as its name implies, could possibly be the hardest game ever made.

Set to a pounding techno beat, the game is absolutely unrelenting in its difficulty and a quick search on Twitter will find hundreds of players putting their gaming skills to the ultimate test. No wonder Eurogamer.net described it as "bafflingly addictive".

New features for the iPhone/iPod Touch version include: a new, improved level layout; a statistics page listing (among other things) how many times you've died; and Twitter and Facebook integration, so players can boast to their friends about how far they can get!"

Source: The Game Website.

101890.name: Spinward Encounters
101890.description:
From the back cover:

Spinward Encounters

Welcome to Spinward Encounters, a series of short adventures and adventure seeds for Traveller from Avenger Enterprises. This book is intended to be used with the Traveller roleplaying game from Mongoose Publishing. Other versions of the Traveller game, and indeed entirely different rules sets, can be used with this adventure with only a minimum of effort, but the contents of this book are specifically designed to be compatible with Mongoose Traveller and with the 'Spinward Marches' background published to accompany those rules.

With a variety of patrons and 16 full-blown adventures set in Amber Zones throughout the Spinward Marches, this book contains enough to keep your campaign going for many, many months in a variety of the Marches most exciting locations.

Spinward Encountered is set in the Spinward Marches sector of the Third Imperium, part of the Official Traveller Universe (OTU) and requires only the Traveller rules to play. However, additional materials may be useful. In particular the Spinward Marches Sourcebook from Mongoose Publishing presents details of the surrounding area and will add greatly to the gaming experience. Other Mongoose Traveller books and supplements may be of use tot he Referee.

To use this supplement, a Referee will require the Traveller Core Rulebook.

101891.name: Baby Maker Extreme
101891.description:
User Summary

Charge up your meter to give extreme birth. Shoot your baby across the hospital at high speeds and try to bounce off of equipment to gain power. You can either shoot out a baby or your Xbox 360 Avatar.

101892.name: The Angry Hand of God
101892.description:
User Summary

Play as the hand of God, smiting citizens with your lightning bolt. You can destroy buildings, and there's an elephant that you can shoot who shows up sometimes.

101893.name: FortressCraft Chapter 1
101893.description:
User Summary

Craft materials and build tools, buildings and weapons, all using your Xbox 360 Avatar.

101894.name: Animal Encounters
101894.description:
From the back cover:

Once players start venturing out from the safety of civilisation and into the wilderness, they will be confronted with all manner of exotic and strange fauna. From deadly predators that will stalk a heavily armed party for weeks before making their lethal ambush, to harmless furballs that make for good pets, Animal Encounters will allow a referee to create new creatures to populate his worlds, each tuned specifically to its environment.

As well as providing many examples of animals already discovered on distant worlds, Animal Encounters not only provides a complete system for referees to create their own, but also a chapter on very strange animals, such as those that live in super-dense gravity environments, or those that can be found floating in the higher reaches of the atmosphere in a gas giant.

101896.name: Cow Trouble
101896.description:
User Summary

Farmer Diddle's cows tried jumping over the moon and ended up getting stuck in the clouds. As a result, there's no milk. So, take part in some extreme cow tipping by dropping balls from the sky to knock down those critters.

101897.name: Total Miner: Forge
101897.description:
Total Miner: Forge is a block mining sandbox game. It has Creation, Combat, Survival, Crafting and RPG elements. Share your creations over Xbox LIVE.

Source: The Developer Website.

Game Modes

Currently there are multiple game modes including Creative where everything is unlimited, as well as Dig Deep which is a survival game mode. In dig deep you start with a wooden pickaxe, 1,000 coins for the shops, as well as two obsidian blocks (teleporters).
Cave Systems

There are many cave systems in the game. You can find tons of caves underground with lava, lurkers and more in them! Be careful though of random cave-ins that can occur and can kill you if your not prepared!
Multiple Worlds

Total Miner: Forge does support multiple worlds on your xbox. You can have up to 2GB's of worlds which is around 100-1000 + depending on the size of the world. As for naming your worlds you can name, and rename your worlds anything up to 14 characters.
Store Blocks

In order to get blocks, tools, or weapons you purchase them from the store blocks. Which in creative mode you can move and have unlimited of. In dig deep you only have the ones you get, so place a obsidian block (teleporter) so you do not loose them! There are two kinds of shops, one for blocks, and one for tools, and weapons.
Gold Coins

Gold is earned by mining blocks and selling them, selling tools, and finding treasure chests down deep in caves, but be careful not to run into any lurkers or cave-ins! Gold currency is used to purchase new blocks, weapons, and tools.

Lurkers

Lurkers are Total Miner's enemies. They are found in dark places, down in caves, as well as in various other places. Be careful not to get caught by one or by eggs of one! They may spawn and kill you or bring friends to attack you!

World Share

One of our game modes, Share, allows you to start a share session and have another gamer join accept them or boot them, then send them any one of your worlds. They can do the same to you. You then can play on their world!

Source: The Developer Website.

101898.description:
Essence is about what defines a person's being.

Essence: The Game of Insights is a communicative game that invites 2 to 7 players to get a more profound understanding of themselves and see each other with new eyes. Eight essential questions and about 340 phrase cards provide a broad range of traits, activities and values allowing the players to assess one another in many different ways. Whoever proves to be most accomplished in perception, reflexion and empathy wins.

In contrast to so-called party games in which exposures, embarrassments and gloating are commonplace, Essence lives off the sincere curiosity about the multifaceted human nature, the joy of authentic openness, vivid discussions and an esteeming look at personal potentials and resources.

Since the game contents are in German as well as in English, Essence can be applied within a multinational context for intercultural exchange.
101898.name: Essence: The Game of Insights
boardgameexpansion: Essence: Archetypes & Emotions
Essence: Handicaps
Essence: Im Labyrinth des Lebens

101899.name: Il gioco di Tangentopoli
101899.description:
Tangentopoli is a trivia game about the history of bribes, corruption, scandal, intrigue, mafia, terrorism was born as a result of the political scandal happened in Italy in the first '90.
It consists of a competition culture to reach the Great Contract (the last box of the track).
Wins the first player exceeds the 47 boxes of the path by responding to questions from time to time for commentary, history, cinema, literature, sports and journalism.
The feature of this game is that it can move forward on the path without actually knowing the answers, just pay a bribe to an opposition player who is able to respond to your seat.
But not enough. After the finish line as winner of the race has yet to undergo the final survey which rewards the competitor who has not made use of bribes.
Contents of the box:
1 board
over 500 questions
60 fiches
1 die
6 pawns/puzzle
rules

101901.name: Tattlebox (Issue 1 - Jun 2011)
rpgissuearticle: Breaking Character: Let's Split the Party
101901.description:
Publisher blurb:

Welcome to Tattlebox, the traveling sideshow!

Find an assortment of wonders and horrors in this ongoing miscellany.

In this issue, you’ll find...

Falling Leaves: a comic of fey proportions
-Let's Split the Party!: an essay on why you should split the party
-14 new weapons, 6 new weapon special features, a new artifact, and more
-Each Tattlebox presents something for everyone: tips, flavor, crunch. Stuff for players and GMs.

Tattlebox #1 is a high quality, full-color, web-optimized, 8-page pdf from Zombie Sky Press. It uses the Open Game License and the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Compatibility License. It is compatible with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game and standard 3.5E fantasy RPGs.

101902.name: D20 Modern Arcana SRD
101902.description:
From publisher blurb:

The d20 Modern Arcana System Reference Document in PDF format.

This is the complete compilation of the RTF files and is fully bookmarked with a completely clickable table of contents for easier navigation and quick finding of information. Amounts to 248 pages.

User summary:

Appears to be the Open Content of Urban Arcana Campaign Setting.

101903.name: D20 Modern Menace SRD
101903.description:
From publisher blurb:

The d20 Modern Menace System Reference Document in PDF format.

This is the complete compilation of the RTF files and is fully bookmarked with a completely clickable table of contents for easier navigation and quick finding of information. Amounts to 63 pages.

User summary:

Appears to be the Open Content of d20 Menace Manual.

101904.name: D20 Modern Future SRD
101904.description:
From publisher blurb:

The d20 Modern Future System Reference Document in PDF format.

This is the complete compilation of the RTF files and is fully bookmarked with a completely clickable table of contents for easier navigation and quick finding of information.

User summary:

Appears to be the Open Content of d20 Future.

101905.name: Action Quest
101905.description:
Back of the box

Action Quest is a real time adventure game played with your joystick controller. You, represented as a ghost, move from room to room in an attempt to capture valuable prizes while eluding monsters and solving puzzles. Score is computed based both on prizes captured and elapsed time. Action Quest is enirely played as an action game, no keyboard input is required.

101906.name: Inconfidentes
101906.description:
In the year of 1787, Brazil was still a colony of Portugal.

The Portuguese empire imposed high taxes (called "Derrama") upon the wealthy ones, trying to get as much gold as possible. Under pressure, influential Brazilians gather to organize a liberty movement by writing articles, poems and manifests, spreading freedom ideas taken from USA's recent act of independence and from the French Revolution.

A group of conspirators, called Inconfidentes, gathered on the state of Minas Gerais, a place that concentrated a lot of gold and valuable gems.

There are six characters on the game, five of them are Inconfidentes: the poet, the farmer, the bachelor, the soldier and the priest, each of them with a unique power. The last one is an imperial guard.

On each round, players choose and move the Inconfidentes, however more than one play may select the same character. Whenever this happens, they must blind bid to decide who will be the leader of that character.

Players vie to spread the ideas through publishing texts (tiles) and hide them around the city, Ouro Preto, formerly named as Vila Rica, and get the population's approval, supporting the struggle to make Minas Gerais free from Portugal. These conspirators also made part of Freemasonry's secret association, and they try to build the first Freemasonry's secret house to support their fight.

When they publish their own texts and get the texts from the others, players make "inconfidência" points (victory points). Furthermore, a character may become a Freemason. If a player manages to get to the 33rd. degree of Freemasonry (all five characters become Freemasons), he becomes a Master Freemason. This gives an alternative ending to the game by finishing the game earlier, and changes Brazilian history! setting Minas Gerais free from Portugal.

If no one gets to be a Master Freemason until 1789, the year of the ninth and last round, everyone goes to jail.
The player with more points (tiles) from texts published by other players, gold retrieved and Freemasonry degrees is the "inconfidência" martyr and the winner.

Not to forget that the historic martyr, Tiradentes, became widely famous afterwords, although was unfortunately killed, hanged for treason by Portugal.

101908.name: Forbiddance
101908.description:
From publisher blurb:

The old priest’s faith wavers, and with a snarl, the ancient vampire lord rips the crucifix from his hands and snaps it in two. Without the correct rites, without the correct acts of purification and holiness, without the correct mindset and without sufficient courage exorcism cannot work. Only the holiest and strongest willed clerics can turn undead; lesser priests lack the faith and confidence necessary to drive away the unliving.

Forbiddance is a variant rule for D20 fantasy gaming, which can easily be included in modern magic and supernatural horror D20 Modern campaigns. Inspired by scenes in works like ‘Salem’s Lot and The Exorcist, Forbiddance adds a new layer of uncertainty and complexity to encounters with undead.

101910.name: Troublemaker
101910.description:
From publisher blurb:

Free20: The Troublemaker Template is a free Otherverse Games product, suitable for inclusion in almost any D20 based campaign. The concepts in this book are as applicable to dungeon crawls as they are modern action campaigns. Special attention is given to using this template in Psi-Watch and Otherverse America campaigns.

All the fictional girls within above share certain traits: all petite, nimble females, all sarcastic and quick-witted, all running on nerve and bravado, all anxious to be taken seriously by their larger, more experienced male partners, and none of ‘em exactly as tough or competent as they think they are.

The Troublemaker Template helps gamers build young heroines who fit the tropes of the fictional girls who inspired the template. This easy to attach template rewards players for fully embracing this character concept, keeps them alive in the face of overwhelming opposition (at least hopefully), and adds a handful of appropriate new weaknesses right out of the comic books.

101911.name: Ghost Encounters
101911.description:
Back of the box

Ghost Encounters is the second in a series of real-time, joystick controlled adventure games following Action Quest, presenting a brand new collection of dangers and puzzles. You, as a ghost, travel through a network of 30 rooms in search of valuable prizes while, at the same time, try to survive the many perils encountered. Of course, a mere ghost cannot overcome all the evil powers striving to block his journey. Luckily you are not a mere ghost but are equipped with the power of transmutation, allowing you to take on the form of other, sometimes more useful, objects. Who knows when a torch or hammer might be just what the witch doctor ordered.

101912.name: Three-Way
101912.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Trius are a race of near humans from the cold mountainous world of Yandell. Yandell is a perilous world, and to survive, the Trius have evolved a unique defense mechanism. Through an innate psionic gift, the Trius can manifest energy duplicates of themselves - short lived twin clones with thoughts and emotions of their own. A lone Trius is never alone. With the help of their two clones, a single Trius can scale the tallest mountain, or face down the most fearsome native xenopredator.

Taking advantage of their natural talent for "triplication" the Trius have developed some of the most innovative forms of unarmed combat in the known galaxy. Trius martial artists are sought out by students of unarmed combat from across the galaxy, and thousands of lonely, mountain-peak dojos can be found scattered across Yandell.

Trius are confident and have a thirst for adventure, only reinforced by their culture-wide practice of marital arts. Even the meekest, most timid Trius enjoys facing new challenges and seeing new horizons. After facing the deadly perils of their craggy homeworld, there is little that can scare or startle a Trius. Many serve on Galaxy Command vessels, usually as space marines, combat training instructors, MPs or boarding experts. There's no one in the galaxy better than a Trius martial artist in a brawl, and Galaxy Command knows it.

Free20: Three-Way is a free Otherverse Games product, suitable for inclusion in any pulp sci-fi D20 Future Campaign, though this PDF is specifically designed to supplement Otherverse Game’s newest release: Galaxy Command.

101913.name: To Rip Asunder
101913.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Now that we've taken, given and created something new, we're going to make like Uratha and tear it all to hell. In this final volume, we demolish the game mechanics, and offer something new to replace them.

What are werewolves, ultimately, but uncontrolled humans? Wild Children are just that: Humans that live only to cause mayhem and gratify themselves. Not Forsaken by any stretch of the imagination, these characters filter down the core pathos that makes playing werewolves fun, without the complexities of the full game.

All Good Gifts takes a long look at the spiritual powers of the Forsaken, and approaches them in a simpler, more holistic way. Werewolf abilities become personal and unique, often subtler, but altogether new and much more primal.

Do you want to play werewolves, but don't want to bother with the complex systems and character creation? The Emergent Beast strips the Storytelling System down to a smidgen of its previous self. Characters exist as a small series of traits, centered mostly on Renown. The game is simplified, to allow more energy spent to emphasize its strengths.

The Family removes tribe, Auspice, Gifts, Rites, and most everything else from Forsaken existence, along with the Shadow and most aspects of the condition. In the wake of all that removal, we leave the pack as the sole organization and interest of the Forsaken. This allows for complex systems of trust and betrayal to drive the game.

101914.name: The Gorger
101914.description:
From publisher blurb:

Free20: The Gorger is a free Otherverse Games product, a minor threat suitable for inclusion in the Otherverse America campaign setting. The Gorger can easily be adapted to most sci-fi and cyberpunk settings, and fits just as well in most fantasy campaigns.

New Monster: The Gorger
The advent of regular contact with aliens species changed Earth's ecology drastically. Otherverse America's largest cities are home to an assortment of minor alien life forms brought to Earth accidentally in the holds of a Stonecutter merchant vessel or a Half Grey refugee ship.

Lifechained DNA has infiltrated Earth's ecology both by design and accident. The Lifer and Choicer nations build supersoldiers whose powers are based upon alien genetic material, while chemical spills and bio-warfare atrocities have spread Lifechain DNA less carefully... and far more widely. The Gorger is one of the best and most common examples of a Lifechained "alpha predator".

101915.name: Tattoos of the Otherverse
101915.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tattoos and subdermal cyberarmor - two expressions of the same drive and desire: change the body, make it to fit the flesh match the desire. To become better, more attractive, more socially adept, a better activist, a better example of what it means to live the heroic life. Body modification, both of the purely decorative and tactical varieties, is a major theme of Otherverse America. A hundred years from now, un-marred flesh is an aberration; by 2107 most adult Americans have at least a few designs etched into their skin.

For inked gamers, here’s a compilation of material relating to tattoos and body-mods. In addition to a bit of world info and character building advice, we’ll take a look at some of the feats and Object Philosophies unique to the setting.

101916.name: Flying Ace
videogameversion: North American Atari 8-bit family 5 1/4" Floppy Disk edition
North American Atari 8-bit family Compact Cassette edition
101916.description:
User Summary

In Flying Ace you play the role of a World War I fighter pilot straffing enemy trucks and engaging enemy fighters. The action is side-scrolling in nature, and you fighter can angle down to stitch up enemy vehicles or loop-the-loop in an attempt to outfly enemy fighters.

101917.name: Modern Players Handbook
101917.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fantasy players have their own Player's Handbook, so why shouldn't Modern players?

This is the first part of a three part set that will comprise the Modern Player's Handbook. This volume covers character generation, character classes, skills, and feats.

Included are all the character classes, skill, and feats from the Modern SRD, D20 Modern Arcana SRD, D20 Modern Future SRD, and selected other Open Game Content sources.

This is the perfect volume if you want to have all the information in one place or don't want to buy the SRD's which contain a lot of information which you may never use.

101918.name: G.F.S. Sorceress
videogameversion: North American Apple II 5-1/4" Disk edition
North American Apple II Cassette edition
North American Atari 8-bit/Apple II/TRS-80 Model I/III edition
101918.description:
Company advertisement

G.F.S. Sorceress -- the first science-fiction adventure game of the continuing saga of Joe Jutin and Selena Skarov aboard the Galactic Federation Starship Sorceress. In the game, the player takes the part of Joe Justin as he attempts to clear himself of a false charge of mutiny. Beautiful full color manuals are included to give the player useful clues in his or her attempt to prove Joe Justin's innocence.

101919.name: Aliens: A Comic Book Adventure
101919.description:
Back of the box

On a distant, isolated space outpost halfway across the galaxy, an unspeakable evil stirs. As Lt. Col. Hericksen, commander of a terraforming team, you must quickly respond to a mysterious distress call. Once you’ve landed, you soon discover that something cruel and vicious lies beneath the outpost’s surface. Something that terrifies even you.

101921.description:
Season of the Witch is a Print on Demand story expansion for Mansions of Madness. Designed by Richard Launius (Arkham Horror, Elder Sign), Season of the Witch is a single-scenario expansion that sends players on a tense and terrifying race against the clock.

There are no new mechanics added in this expansion; it is purely an additional scenario for the base game that will use the modular board setup from Mansions of Madness. The setup of this scenario will be dictated by the included event cards and reference sheets.

In this macabre game of horror, insanity, and mystery for two to five players, each game takes place within a pre-designed story that provides players with a unique map and several combinations of plot threads. These threads affect the monsters that investigators may encounter, the clues they need to find, and which climactic story ending they will ultimately experience. One player takes on the role of the keeper, controlling the monsters and other malicious powers within the story. The other players take on the role of investigators, searching for answers while struggling to survive with their minds intact.
(Note: variations in printing mean that cards from Print on Demand expansions will be subtly different in appearance and texture from base game cards. Therefore, any necessary base game cards (such as the “nothing of interest” Exploration cards) will be reprinted in each expansion, to retain a consistent appearance when shuffled.)
101921.name: Mansions of Madness: Season of the Witch
boardgameexpansion: Mansions of Madness
boardgamepodcastepisode: Game Gab: Gen Con 2011: Richard Launius

101922.name: Calciocart
101922.description:
Calciocart is a game of simulated football with special cards that reproduce all the tactical and technical situations that may occur during a football game.
The cards are divided into three groups: Attack, Defense and Goalie.
The game is played between two players. Each choose 12 attack cards and 12 defense, which wants to use among the more than 100 that make up their decks, depending on choice of tactics.
The first player plays a card of attack (usually a passing) if the defender has a defense card that cancels that played by the opponent, he becomes the attacker, otherwise the first player may shoot at goal.
If an attempt on goal is saved the game will restart with the roles attacker / defender reversed, otherwise the attacking player has scored a goal.
After playing for 45 minutes, the first time end and pass on second.
After 90 minutes of play the player who has scored the most number of goals wins.

101923.name: Invest
101923.description:
The Fortune Building Securities Game.

Starting with $10,000 players buy stock in leading corporations- selling them back for profit or loss depending on whether they're in a Recession, Depression, Prosperity or Recovery.

First player to reach $50,000 in cash and stocks is the winner.

101924.name: Stumps
101924.description:
Stumps is a new and exciting 20-20 cricket card and dice game.

Pick your team, choose your favourite players, friends or even family. Win the toss and decide whether to bat or bowl.

Bat and decide on when to attack and when to defend. Be aware attacking can lead to losing wickets but play too defensively and your score might not be good enough.

Read the bowler's tactics and anticipate the next delivery.

Bowl tactically to restrict runs and take wickets. Bowl a good length or bowl short, and decide wisely when to use wicket taking deliveries such as Yorkers or Slower balls.

Play one-versus-one or in a group to create the ultimate team.

[Description taken from rear of game box]

101925.name: Crush, Crumble and Chomp!
videogamehonor: 1981 Charles S. Roberts Best Computer Game Nominee
101925.description:
from the back of the box

In Crush, Crumble and Chomp!, you can play one of six featured monsters to attack the city of your choice: San Francisco, Washington, DC, New York City or Tokyo Harbor. Breathe fire, terrorize cities, snack on a horrified populace, and further develope your villanous personality. CRUSH, CRUMBLE and CHOMP!

Take on the persona of any six demonic beasties, select from four mouth watering metropoli and five different objectives -- over 100 possible scenarios, complete with graphic mayhem and the resounding thunder of your monsterly presence, await your beastly appetite.

101926.description:
To all budding chefs – utensils ready, set, cook!

Either on your own or in teams, complete the challenges in L'atelier des Chefs set by the chef and become his right-hand man. Separate eggs, sabre champagne, flip as many pancakes as possible – in your hands the cards will become kitchen utensils and fine dishes. You will have to throw them, catch them, look at them, sort them, put them on top of each other...all under pressure from the egg timer! You will have to combine dexterity and ingenuity in order to beat your opponents.

Keep the game going over a hot stove with ten interactive recipe cards, concocted by the Chef's kitchen experts!
101926.name: L'atelier des Chefs

101927.name: Biker Mice From Mars
101927.description:
In this game win the player who manages to defeat the evil Limburger after managing to avoid the enemies encountered on the board, and avoid the dangers encountered on the elevated ramp.
Once you reach Limburger, the player has three chances to be able to hit the figure of the wicked and drop it.
Each player has its own character who will move on the board trying to collect cards that allow access to the elevated road. In this attempt they must defeat the enemies they encounter.
The elevated road contain dangers and traps to be avoided by players to reach the point from which they can shoot with the catapult at Limburger and win the game.

101929.description: This game combines elements of boardgames and miniatures, in a system that is card-driven. Cards drive the impulses that take place during each turn, and each player has a deck of cards, made up from the troops under his or her command. Each soldier's "deck" of cards reflects abilities and traits-- perhaps about how well they shoot or how slowly they move or how attracted they are to things like fresh milk, hot food, or loot. There are some Soldiers (called "Characters") included in the base game (Day of Days) which are common, but the others in DoD and all that are purchased separately have unique characteristics (which all balance out to be "equal" according to a complex math formula which is seamless to the players). So players can only get the best out of their forces after they have learned each soldier's strengths and weaknesses. "Day of Days" includes moveable mapboard tiles, hand-painted 20mm miniatures (by FAA), scenarios, cards (several decks!) and everything needed to play. Additional Soldiers give more choices and more fun.
101929.name: Sergeants Miniatures Game: Day of Days
boardgameexpansion: Sergeants D-Day: German Fusilier Assault Tactics expansion
Sergeants D-Day: German Light Infantry Battle Patrol Tactics expansion
Sergeants D-Day: German Light Infantry Infiltration Tactics expansion
Sergeants D-Day: US Glider Assault Tactics expansion
Sergeants D-Day: US Parachute Battle Patrol Tactics expansion
Sergeants D-Day: US Parachute Infiltration Tactics expansion
Sergeants Hell on Wheels
Sergeants Hell on Wheels M2A1 Halftrack
Sergeants Hell on Wheels M4A1 Sherman
Sergeants Hell on Wheels M8 Greyhound
Sergeants Hell on Wheels Marder-IIIM
Sergeants Hell on Wheels PzKw-IVH
Sergeants Hell on Wheels SdKfz 250-1 Halftrack
Sergeants Miniatures Game: Brécourt Manor
Sergeants Miniatures Game: Expansion Squads and Leaders
Sergeants Miniatures Game: Hasty Positions Normandy Expansion
Sergeants Miniatures Game: La Fière Bridge
Sergeants Miniatures Game: Manoir de Normandie
Sergeants Miniatures Game: Pontigou Farm Normandy Expansion
Sergeants Miniatures Game: Prepared Positions expansion
Sergeants Miniatures Game: Road to Carentan
Sergeants Miniatures Game: Tactics Module
boardgameaccessory: Sergeants Miniatures Game Master Kit
boardgamepodcastepisode: GrogCast Season 1, The Lost Episode
The GrogCast, Episode 15 – Origins Wrap-up Special

boardgamepublisher: Greater Than Games (Dice Hate Me Games)
101930.description:
Think Ferris wheels, roller-coasters, carousels, flying swings, and bumper cars! Open your Carnival for business before the other carnies do by building four of the five available rides along your Midway. Then cue the Carnival music and watch the crowd rush in!

Carnival is a card game of set collection for 2-4 players, ages 12+, that utilizes dice to determine actions. Each turn, a player rolls three dice and chooses two of them to perform actions which can allow them to gain and discard cards from their hand and/or Midway. Each player also has three tickets that may be discarded to affect the dice rolls or block other players' actions.
101930.name: Carnival
boardgameexpansion: Carnival: The Sideshow
Carnival: Wild! Die
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 72 March Craziness Dice Game Style Part 1
The One About GenCon and the WBC
The One About Getting Kickstarted
The One About Getting Lucky
The One About Richard Launius
The One About the Kickstarter Bubble
The One About the Last Game on Earth

101931.name: Cat: Revised
101931.description:
From the Publisher's Web Store


The Boogeyman is still under the bed.



Bloody Mary is still in the mirror.



All your childhood fears are alive and well, looking for you.



And your only guardian... is Mister Whiskers.
 
Cat: A Little Game about Little Heroes is a game about housecats protecting their owners from monsters they can't see. It is designed to be played by gamers of any age with a system simple enough for children and sophisticated enough for grown-ups.
 
This new edition of the classic game includes streamlined rules and additional Narrator advice. It also includes advice for playing the game with smaller gamers and a new chapter on incorporating magic cats into your existing games--no matter what system you happen to be using.


Published in June, 2011.

101932.name: Horror Island
101932.description:
This game attempts to capture the feel of a Horror Movie in a Board Game. Players start off as survivors of an airplane crash, they know that something is wrong but not what. They must first leave the safety of the abandoned village and collect clues from other island locations. Once they have collected enough clues a Horror themed Goal is revealed that usually requires gathering certain objects and bringing them to a given location (eg. To escape from the island you must take the motor from the docks and repair it in the workshop, and return with the keys and gasoline to escape).

As the players move about the island they will come under attack from the Peril Deck. The hand of cards each player holds represents the energy they have to escape from the attacks, attacks chip away at your hand (the Action Deck also represents how much daylight is left). If you ever run out of cards in your hand after an attack you die... but the player can always return to the village to grab another survivor to wander off to find out what is going on.

The game contains a few horror themed cards including "I know what to do", "it's now or never", and my favorite for twist endings "It's not what you think" all balanced to bring a horror movie to your tabletop in about half-an-hour.

NOTE: All files necessary to play the game are located in the files section below :-)

101933.name: Cabela's Dangerous Hunts 2011
101933.description:
A global hunting adventure that quickly turns into a terrifying pursuit of the world’s deadliest animals. In the ultimate battle of man versus nature, American marksman Cole Rainsford and his estranged father go on a safari to hunt for man-eating  beasts in the heart of the African wilderness.

KEY FEATURES:

Fully Integrated Wireless Hunting Controller/Peripheral
First of a kind controller for PlayStation®3 system and Xbox 360® and an innovative new Wii peripheral provides the ultimate hunting/shooting experience. The TOP SHOT ELITE features pump action reload, adjustable stock and innovative red filter lens that reveals  hidden object in the environment such as blood trials, tracks and deadly predators.

A global hunting adventure that quickly turns into a terrifying pursuit of the world’s deadliest animals. In the ultimate battle of man versus nature, American marksman Cole Rainsford and his estranged father go on a safari to hunt for man-eating  beasts in the heart of the African wilderness.

Intense Storyline
A story of revenge and redemption as dark mysteries and secrets are revealed. Experience the suspense, drama and face kill-or-be killed scenarios in this action packed first-person hunting game.

Experience the suspense, drama and face kill-or-be killed scenarios in this action packed first-person hunting game.

The World’s Deadliest Animals
Face the World’s deadliest predators in boss battles that will test your will to survive.

Shooting Galleries
A next generation of shooting galleries that will take cunning instinct and expert skill to make it out alive - perfect for the TOP SHOT ELITE peripheral.

Simultaneous Multiplayer
Play through variety of hunts competitively head to head or in co-op mode, all on a single screen.

Source: The Publisher Website.

101934.description:
Publisher blurb: "Death Ride - Hafid Ridge provides a small, introductory game into the Death Ride system by Grognard Simulations. It is a platoon level tactical game with forces representing the British 7th Armor Brigade in front of Hafid Ridge during Operation Battleaxe. The result of this battle caused the removal of General Wavell from his command in the desert. 5th Leichte Divisions', soon to be 21st Panzers', PanzerJager battalion and some supporting flak elements withstood a determined attempt to force them off the ridge and move north toward Ft Capuzzo.

Main elements of change from the Death Ride Kursk games is a move to use silouhettes for the armor units and double sided counters. There will be more player aids and the size of this game will be perfect for those looking to finish a play through in a few hours. This game may hopefully become a tournament game since the challenge to both sides is quite high.

Players will find this game very easy to start playing and will then be looking for the meatier elements of the Death Ride Series after they are bitten by the Death Ride bug. The amount of critical decision making and knife-edge suspense will have you wanting more. And we will find you more."
101934.name: Death Ride: Hafid Ridge

101935.name: Fluffy: Operation Overkill
101935.description:
User Summary

This is a side scrolling platformer where you control a squirrel in a hazmat suit. All other animals have gone mad and so you must shoot them in the body and head for maximum bloodshed. Also, there's a mode with zombies.

101936.name: Fly Butterfly, Fly!
101936.description:
User Summary

You control a slow moving butterfly net. Your aim is to capture butterflies as they appear and thus unlock background pictures.

101937.name: Capitanes de Mar y Tierra
101937.description:
From the publisher:

You are a young captain in charge of your own fleet of ships, seeking fame and fortune. Conquer the islands and increase your wealth so you can be a powerful admiral.

Have you found a section of ocean where there are several islands that are not under the power of any kingdom or country and it is your duty to land on them and claim its riches for you. Be careful as other pirates have been established on nearby islands and are in search of new domains, you will fight them, showing who is the most powerful captain, using your ships to take out your opponents.

Have fun, managing your ships, conquering islands landing in their ports, increase your wealth, and if necessary destroy your opponents by blowing up your traps. Who will be the most successful captain?

The board represents a section of ocean with several islands, each with its port and wealth. Each island has a number that represents wealth and every time you take possession of an island, its richness is added to the total wealth of the player.

Each turn each player can make up to six actions that can be: Build, move or disembark. Additionally, the player may attack one or more opponents or blow up one of his traps.

There are two ways to end the game:

1 - Time limit: At the beginning of the game a limit of time is proposed. Upon completion of the time the winner is determined by the number of ships that the player have on the board and the wealth earned.
